title: Copernicus Hubs Essentials - The Coastal and the Arctic hubs
description: The Copernicus Marine Service is hosting a 2-part webinar series for beginners, designed to engage Earth Observation communities worldwide. This series is perfect for first-time users looking to explore, access, and use Coastal and Arctic Copernicus data with confidence. By the end, participants will have a clear understanding of all availableHubsresources and how to apply them to their work. This 2-part webinar series will follow this agenda: Session #1 - Copernicus Coastal Hub (12 Sept) Get introduced to the platform: data catalogue, Viewer and real-world applications showcasing the use of data in coastal regions. Session #2 - Copernicus Arctic Hub (19 Sept) Get introduced to the platform: data catalogue, Viewer and real-world applications showcasing the use of arctic data. Each session will  featureguest speakersfrom the Earth Observation community, who will share their experiences and showcase practical applications of data available on the Copernicus Hubs.
organizer: Noveltis, Copernicus Marine Service, Mercator Ocean International

title: Marine Data 4 Mediterranean Sea 2025
description: The Copernicus Marine Service is hosting a two-day online workshop dedicated to increasing user uptake and awareness in the mediterranean region. The event is focusing on the Mediterranean Sea, examining key coastal and oceanic phenomena across the entire basin. Topics will explore phenomena such as Mediterranean circulation patterns, sea surface temperature trends, marine heatwaves, salinity and stratification changes, sea level rise, and ocean acidification.

title: Conference for Adaptive Mesh Refinement and Applications 2025 (AMR 25)
description:
The conference for Adaptive Mesh Refinement and Applications 2025 (AMR 25) will take place September 02 to 04 at the DLR in Cologne.
Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) is a computational technique used in numerical simulations to enhance efficiency and accuracy. By dynamically adjusting the resolution of a computational grid, AMR focuses computational resources on areas of interest — such as regions with complex phenomena or steep gradients — while maintaining coarser resolution in less critical areas. This adaptability allows for detailed modeling of complex systems, such as fluid dynamics, astrophysics, and structural analysis, without incurring the high computational cost of a uniformly fine mesh. The result is a more effective use of computational power, leading to faster simulations and more accurate results.
At AMR25 we welcome contributions from AMR and related fields, including other adaptive methods.
Possible topics include, but are not limited to:
Dynamic and static AMR algorithms and techniques
Applications of dynamic and static AMR
Time adaptivity
Mesh generation and CAD
Other adaptive methods, such as Partition of Unity methods, X-FEM, p-adaptivity etc.
We are looking forward to welcome you in Cologne in September 2025.
Sincerely yours,
Johannes Holke
Chair of AMR2025
location: Geb. 53, Casino, DLR Cologne, Linder Höhe, Köln, 51147, Deutschland

title: IAA Mobility 2025
description:
Nach erfolgreichen Auftritten in den Jahren 2021 und 2023 findet die IAA Mobility 2025 erneut in München statt. Unter dem Motto „It’s All About Mobility“ werden wegweisende Innovationen rund um das Thema Mobilität erlebbar gemacht.
Auch das DLR ist wieder mit dabei und präsentiert seine aktuellen Forschungsschwerpunkte. Besuchen Sie uns auf dem Summit in der Messe, Halle A1, Stand B31, sowie auf dem Open Space am Odeonsplatz.
Weitere Informationen folgen in Kürze.

title: Stuttgart Symposium on electrochemical Energy Technology (S2EET) 2025
description:
The decarbonisation of society will require new solutions for the convergence of power generation, hydrogen production and storage.
The Stuttgart Symposium on Electrochemical Energy Technology (S2EET) focuses on cutting-edge topics in the field of electrochemical energy technology – fuel cells – water electrolysis – rechargeable batteries. These technologies are considered key to the success of the energy systems transformation.
The specific topics are addressed from the perspective of industry and academia, thus providing a comprehensive view and strengthening the interaction between academia and industry.
Focus in 2025 – Cell Innovations Leading to System Improvements
This year we focus on “Cell Innovations Leading to System Improvements”at the SEETS, addressing how advancements in cell materials, design, and architecture can enhance the performance, efficiency, and sustainability of entire energy systems.
Discussions will cover innovations in fuel cells, electrolyzers, and batteries, particularly in terms of:
Material developments (e.g., advanced catalysts,alternative materials reducing critical raw material dependency)
Cell design and architecture (e.g., electrode structures, membrane optimization, manufacturing advancements)
System-level integration (e.g., cost reduction, scalability, lifetime improvements)
Sustainability challenges (e.g., critical material availability, recycling strategies, lifecycle assessments)
It would be a pleasure to welcome you at DLR Stuttgart on 25 – 26 September 2025.

title: Space Generation Congress (SGC) 2025
description:
The Space Generation Congress (SGC) is the annual meeting of the Space Generation Advisory Council (SGAC), held in conjunction with the International Astronautical Congress (IAC) in the hosting country. Every year, the SGC event gathers around 150 outstanding students and young professionals passionate about space. Participants are selected via a highly competitive application process. 

The 23rd edition of the SGC aims to bring together the next generation of space leaders to discuss sustainability both in space and on Earth. Under the theme 'Next-Gen Space Leaders: Innovating an Equitable and Sustainable Access to Space for the Future,' the event will provide a platform for young leaders to share perspectives on international space development, equity, and sustainability.

Learn more and register: https://spacegeneration.org/sgc2025
category_string: Space Policy, Sustainability, International Cooperation, Youth Leadership, STEM Education

title: 3rd Middle East Generation Workshop (ME-SGW) 2025
description:
The 3rd edition of the Middle East Space Generation Workshop (ME-SGW) will take place on November 1-2, 2025, at Middle East Technical University (METU), Ankara, Türkiye. 

Objectives of ME-SGW 2025:
- Establish a collaborative environment for students and young professionals to engage with academia and industry leaders
- Strengthen regional and international cooperation in the space sector
- Highlight Türkiye and Middle East's growing space capabilities and ambitions
- Address regional challenges through space technology applications
- Empower local talent through mentorship, presentations, and capacity-building activities
- Expand SGAC’s youth engagement in the Middle East
- Leverage Türkiye’s strategic position to foster cross-regional partnerships and sustainable development
- Build momentum towards IAC 2026, Antalya

Learn more and register: https://spacegeneration.org/event/3rd-me-swg-2025
location: Middle East Technical University (METU), Ankara, Türkiye
category_string: Space Policy, Sustainability, Youth Leadership, Regional Cooperation, STEM Education

title: 5 Insights on Systemic Risk & Resilience Every Leader Must Act on Now
description:
This 3-hour online Masterclass is divided into three ~40 min blocks, each followed by 10 mins of Q&A, with short breaks in between. Two timeslots are available for the masterclass, either 6-9am UTC or 2-5pm UTC.

We are faced with a “VUCA world on steroids” - our outer context appears ever more Volatile and Uncertain, in addition to being Complex beyond our current grasp and Ambiguous.

Rapid tectonic shifts in global trading, security systems and overall world order highlight the fragility of current strategies, business models, and assumptions behind projected returns and margins.

Science continues to make leaps in understanding the planetary emergency: what were previously considered worst-case catastrophic projections are now highly likely. Mid-range projections are no longer plausible.

All of these factors dictate revisiting systemic risk and exploring the specific steps that strategic mitigation and adaptation demand today.

Join us as we ask and answer: What does a very volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous world demand of business leaders?

Learn more & register here.

title: edie26
description:
Experience the UK’s longest-running and most impactful sustainable business event!

Now entering its 16th year, edie26 builds on the success of edie25, with 83% of attendees stating the event had a direct, positive impact on their organisation’s sustainability strategy, and 92% saying they feel more energised to drive positive change as a result of attending.

Every aspect of the edie26 event has been elevated, from deeper action-focused discussions across themed stages to the all-new Collaboration Hub at the heart of the show floor. In a packed calendar of climate and sustainability events, edie26 is the collaborative experience not to be missed.

title: How to Break Free from the Burden of Short-Term Profits
description:
Amid economic volatility and planetary emergency, entrenchment may seem intuitive, but is in fact a dangerously short-sighted strategy. Systemic risk mitigation, strategic resilience, and adaptation require breakthrough transformation and systemic leadership. Both need patient funding and rarely deliver quarter-to-quarter profit growth.

How can we dismantle widespread short-term return expectations—a key systemic barrier to unlocking long-term shareholder and systemic value?

This webinar provides a step-by-step guide on how exactly to do so.

“In today’s world, pursuing short-term profits is how we wipe out all shareholder value…along with everything we hold most dear.” — Alice Kalro

If the date & time for the webinar (shown above in UK time) do not work for you, you may register to receive a recording.

title: Next Economies Summit 2025
description:
We are partnering with the Next Economies Summit 2025, on 12-14 September 2025 in Istanbul, organised by the Prosumer Economy Society and Kadir Has University Center for Energy and Sustainable Development (CESD). The summit will bring together social movements, networks, organisations, innovative business models, global leaders, investors, social entrepreneurs, and policymakers working for economic transformation; and aims to accelerate the transition to sustainable and fair economies.

Going beyond idea-sharing, the summit aims to foster collective action for systemic change. This important gathering seeks to create an inspiring space for all who wish to contribute to a fairer, more sustainable, and co-designed economic future.

This year’s theme is on “United Next Economies” - it’s time to redesign economic systems to tackle climate, biodiversity and social crisis. The summit will host some of the world’s leading voices in economic transformation. Prominent speakers include Katherine Trebeck (WEAll, Club of Rome), Amitabh Behar (Oxfam International), Ashish Kothari (Vikalp Sangam), Mads Christensen (Greenpeace International), and Simel Eşim (ILO).

For those unable to attend in-person in Istanbul, online participation is available. Join from anywhere in the world and be part of this global movement.

title: “Mentorship with Pride” | Space Pride Webinar
description:
Inclusive mentorship matters: Join our Women4Space x Space Pride webinar to learn, connect, and build with pride.

This virtual event will explore how mentorship can embrace the LGBTQIA+ experience worldwide, providing strategies to ensure that no identity is left behind in the journey to space and beyond.

Guest Speaker:
Molly MacEachen – Space Sustainability Consultant & Founder of Mac’s Impact

In this session, you will:
- Discover more about Space Pride, their initiatives, and why their work is crucial to the space sector
- Gain strategies for #InclusiveMentorship that empowers diverse identities
- Learn how to create supportive and affirming mentor–mentee relationships
- Understand the importance of representation in shaping the future of aerospace
- Connect with a global community committed to diversity and inclusion

Rooted in our mission “Space for Me, Space for You”, this conversation is for space professionals, enthusiasts, mentors, mentees, allies, and advocates alike.

title: FME Form Introductory Training
description: This course is Avineon Tensing’s way of saying “Welcome to the FME Platform”, your journey starts with FME Form (previously FME Desktop) where all your automations are authored. Visual programming is at the heart of Data Integration, so let Avineon Tensing’s Certified FME Trainer guide your understanding of the FME tools and capabilities. On our FME Form Introductory course we take you from zero to data hero, introducing you to the fundamentals and concepts of FME Workbench, the FME Data Inspector and the Quick Translator from the word go. We focus on the settings that are vital to be efficient, and the best approach to build excellent Workspaces that you and your team can be proud of. Unsurprisingly, Transformers, the tools that process your data, get plenty of airtime. We show you how to add them to your canvas, slick ways to use them and of course, we’ll help you understand which one to use next. With so much data out there for you to process, we’ve also built our content around unique custom European and UK-based examples, that we use in our courses to give you a local context. We use this data so you can see how to read and write it effectively and make new integrations, and of course, all wrapped up with our best practice techniques and tips and tricks to help you be efficient quickly. Our Certified FME Trainers in the UK are David Eagle and Simon Green and they’ve both got 15+ years of experience with the FME Platform, data integration, GIS analysis and of course, they’ve been delivering software training for most of their careers, so you’re definitely in a ‘Safe’ pair of hands. Find out more and register for the next course with Avineon Tensing .

title: 1Spatial's World Tour 2025 Featuring FME - Edinburgh
description: Beyond Today: The Future of Spatial Data The 1Spatial World Tour 2025 is where innovation meets insight. This year’s theme, “Beyond Today: The Future of Spatial Data,” takes you on a journey into the cutting-edge of location data management. Discover how advancements in automation, integration, and AI are reshaping the spatial landscape, not just for today, but for the future. From driving smarter decisions to unlocking the power of geospatial, non-spatial and unstructured data, we’ll show you how to future-proof your workflows and maximise the value of your data. Gain exclusive takeaways from the FME User Conference 2025, including the latest in FME 2025.0 features that bring AI directly into your processes through the “All-Data, Any-AI” approach. Learn how to boost your return on investment with best practices, cost-effective license use, and new functionality. We’ll also explore seamless integrations with platforms like Azure Power Platform, Databricks, and Snowflake , enabling powerful cross-platform data collaboration and consistency across your organisation. Whether you’re just starting out or have years of experience, this event is designed for new, beginner, and advanced users of FME, offering value at every skill level. Find more information and register with 1Spatial

title: FME Form Advanced Training
description: This course offers you Avineon Tensing’s deep dive into FME. Designed for the seasoned data professional and existing FME Form (previously FME Desktop) user, our Certified FME Trainers will guide you to the peak of data integration. We’ll focus on advanced data management techniques, efficiency, performance and best practice. On our FME Form Advanced course, we help to move you towards being an FME power user. We’ll even advise you on becoming a Certified FME Professional if you want to use this course as a stepping stone to helping you achieve personal accreditation. Our trainers will equip you with the skills you’ll need to ensure the automation processes you build, can utilise the best-practice techniques and new features you’ll need for the next stage of your data integration journey. We cover advanced attribute management and manipulation; an important skill when so much of our data has strings that need altering or checking! We help you hone your Workspace design skills, to improve the performance of your production tasks, whilst also making your more involved Workspaces easier to maintain. We also cover plenty of advanced parameter functionality to help give your processes the ability to multi-task. You’ll also have a nice takeaway tool in the form of a custom transformer you’ll build, to interact with a useful UK hosted API. With so much data out there for you to process, we’ve also built our content around unique custom European and UK-based examples, that we use in our courses to give you a local context. Our Certified FME Trainers in the UK are David Eagle and Simon Green and they’ve both got 15+ years of experience with the FME Platform, data integration, GIS analysis and of course, they’ve been delivering software training for most of their careers, so you’re definitely in a ‘Safe’ pair of hands. Find out more and register for the next course with Avineon Tensing .

title: Introduction to QGIS
description: This two-day intensive course introduces the core functionality of QGIS, taking you through all the tools you will need to get started with the software. QGIS is a free desktop GIS, providing the same GIS functionality as commercial desktop GIS solutions such as MapInfo or ArcGIS for Desktop. The course is delivered using instructor-led real world examples where you learn by ‘doing’. The course covers topics including, getting started with QGIS, map navigation and general mapping tips, selecting and querying your data, applying symbology, data analysis and editing, accessing external data sources and cartographic output. Find more information and register directly with Arkance

title: Cadcorp SIS Desktop for Crime and Incident Analysis
description: This course will enable a Cadcorp SIS Desktop user to build upon the knowledge acquired in the Introduction to Cadcorp SIS Desktop course. You will take an in-depth look at how to use a range of methodologies to identify and analyse patterns in crime and incident data. Find more information and register directly with Cadcorp

description: Learn from the experts how to use the essential components and capabilities in FME through personal tuition in this two-day course, which includes extensive hands-on, problem-solving exercises. This training course is suitable for you if: Find more information and register directly with 1Spatial

title: FME Flow Authoring Training
description: This course is Avineon Tensing’s focus on ‘enterprise’ data integration and will help you get started, or formalise your understanding of FME Flow (previously FME Server). When your needs extend beyond the desktop, FME Flow is your application of choice to enable enterprise automation. We will introduce you to scheduling, webhooks, automations, event-driven notifications and much more! On our FME Flow Authoring course we take your skills into the world of Enterprise data integration, linking up your existing experience with FME Form, to its enterprise companion. We introduce you to the complete user interface and we’ll of course discuss deployment options too, to ensure you start off on the right foot. Processing power matters, so managing your engine capacity, standard and consumption-based credit is a key part of the course. We’ll make sure you can publish your Workspaces, host them, run them and register them with the right service. So whether you’re interested in self-service data automation, task scheduling or real-time data processing… this is the course for you. With so much data out there for you to process, we’ve also built our content around unique custom European and UK-based examples, that we use in our courses to give you a local context. We use this data so you can see how to read and write it effectively and make new integrations, and of course, all wrapped up with our best practice techniques and tips and tricks to help you be efficient quickly. Our Certified FME Trainers in the UK are David Eagle and Simon Green and they’ve both got 15+ years of experience with the FME Platform, data integration, GIS analysis and of course, they’ve been delivering software training for most of their careers, so you’re definitely in a ‘Safe’ pair of hands. Find out more and register for the next course with Avineon Tensing .

title: Say hello to AI assistants: a helping hand in ArcGIS
description: AI is becoming a familiar part of the ArcGIS system, offering new ways to support you in everyday tasks. In this webinar, we’ll introduce a new generation of AI assistants – currently in beta and preview – designed to help users work more efficiently and access information more easily. Through demonstrations, we’ll show how you can best utilise and work with these assistants to streamline tasks like building forms in ArcGIS Survey123, building Arcade expressions in Map Viewer, exploring documentation, and more. Join us to see what AI assistants are available to try now, and find out what’s to come on the road ahead. Register here.

title: Unlocking the Power of Ordnance Survey NGD: Practical Insights for Smarter Decision-Making
description: Following on from our popular webinar on OS Data Services, this session takes a deeper dive into the Ordnance Survey National Geographic Database (NGD). We’ll explore how NGD is transforming access to authoritative mapping data, delivering greater consistency, flexibility, and efficiency for organisations working across utilities, infrastructure, environment, and government sectors. We’ll share practical examples of how NGD can be integrated into GIS platforms, helping teams unlock richer insights, streamline workflows, and accelerate their move from legacy systems to the next generation of Ordnance Survey data. Whether you’re in operations, planning, or asset management, this session will provide clear guidance on what NGD means for your organisation. Find more information and register directly with MGISS

title: The Geospatial Leadership Certificate (GLC)
description: The Global Leadership Certificate (GLC) – is a unique leadership training course designed specifically for Geospatial practitioners. Module 1: Leadership Module 2: Team Building Module 3: Building The Business Case for Investments Module 4: Influencing Decision Makers Module 5: Project Management Module 6: Marketing Strategy and Planning Module 7: Sustainable Business Models Module 8: Governance and Policy Module 9: Basic Sales Techniques The webinar will be delivered by Andrew Coote, CEO and Harry Storer, Director of Strategy at ConsultingWhere.  Both have long careers in management across the globe and in many different economic sectors. We have collaborated with a series of industry experts to create this course to ensure maximum access to insightful and practical solutions. Find more information by visiting ConsultingWhere website or contact Andrew directly on info@consultingwhere.com

title: 1Spatial's World Tour 2025 Featuring FME - London
description: Beyond Today: The Future of Spatial Data The 1Spatial World Tour 2025 is where innovation meets insight. This year’s theme, “Beyond Today: The Future of Spatial Data,” takes you on a journey into the cutting-edge of location data management. Discover how advancements in automation, integration, and AI are reshaping the spatial landscape, not just for today, but for the future. From driving smarter decisions to unlocking the power of geospatial, non-spatial and unstructured data, we’ll show you how to future-proof your workflows and maximise the value of your data. Gain exclusive takeaways from the FME User Conference 2025, including the latest in FME 2025.0 features that bring AI directly into your processes through the “All-Data, Any-AI” approach. Learn how to boost your return on investment with best practices, cost-effective license use, and new functionality. We’ll also explore seamless integrations with platforms like Azure Power Platform, Databricks, and Snowflake , enabling powerful cross-platform data collaboration and consistency across your organisation. Whether you’re just starting out or have years of experience, this event is designed for new, beginner, and advanced users of FME, offering value at every skill level. Find more information and register with 1Spatial

title: Advanced QGIS
description: This classroom based course builds on the delegates existing knowledge of QGIS. It comprises a series of presentations, demos and computer practical sessions using FREE open source GIS software. The example datasets are taken from a variety of fields. Delegates are introduced to advanced analysis techniques using both raster and vector data. The course includes a basic introduction to the PostgresSQL/PostGIS Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton

title: MapInfo Foundation Level Course
description: The foundation course is designed for people who will be using MapInfo on a day to day basis. The focus of the course is on basic operations, and how to find, and use, the MapInfo tools to carry them out. The course is designed as a series of modules covering different aspects of MapInfo use, and each session will use a worked example for the delegates to follow on their own PCs. Find more information and register directly with CDR Group

title: ArcGIS Pro Foundation – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Designed for beginners, this hands-on ArcGIS Pro training course from Idox Geospatial introduces essential GIS concepts, spatial data analysis, map creation, and geoprocessing tools using ESRI’s powerful desktop software. Whether you’re a student, professional, or simply curious about GIS, this instructor-led course will guide you step-by-step through the fundamentals—no prior experience needed. You’ll learn how to navigate ArcGIS Pro, work with spatial data, create high-quality maps, and perform basic geospatial analysis. Perfect for anyone looking to build practical GIS skills, this course provides a solid foundation and the confidence to apply ArcGIS Pro in real-world scenarios. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. If you’re looking for custom GIS training or an on-site GIS course, please contact hello-geo@idoxgroup.com to discuss your requirements.

title: Esri UK Scottish Conference
description: This year we are excited to welcome you all to Edinburgh! Whether you have attended in the past or you have recently joined the Scottish GIS community, we are really looking forward to seeing you. The Esri UK Scottish Conference will showcase GIS storytelling, technology demonstrations and customer innovation at its very best. There will be Esri technical talks and customer presentations plus lightning talks and free training courses during the sessions. Full details of the agenda will be made available soon! Find more information and register directly with Esri UK

title: CGI and AGI: Exploring Geospatial Career Pathways Webinar
description: Are you interested in what the next step on your geospatial path could be? The AGI Early Careers network are collaborating with CGI to discuss career paths, progression and recognising opportunities in your early geospatial career, on Tuesday the 7th October 2025 (1-2pm). In this session, we will be joined by a panel of former and current CGI graduates who will share their journeys, challenges, and successes as early career professionals. This is a fantastic opportunity to ask questions, gain valuable insights and network with peers and industry professionals. The session will be facilitated by the committee at AGI ECN. CGI has delivered geospatial services since 1992, and is a recognized leader around the globe. Our Geospatial Centers of Excellence have hundreds of experts working in 13 countries on 4 continents. CGI have an extensive track record of delivering major geospatial projects and collaborate with world’s leading geospatial solution providers. Whether you are a student, graduate, early career professional or just interested, we would love to see you.

title: FME Flow Authoring Training
description: This course is a key course for FME users intending to author workspaces for use on FME Server. It will focus on FME Desktop functionality with specific relevance for FME Server implementation. This includes sessions on the use of parameters, different FME Services and how to author for them, and advanced workflows designed for FME Server. Learn from the experts how to use the essential components and capabilities in FME through personal tuition in this two-day course, which includes extensive hands-on, problem-solving exercises. title: AGI GeoCymru 2025
description: The annual AGI Cymru Annual Conference is a focal point for the geo-community in Wales to come together and explore key geographical topics that are important to our members in Wales from tackling environmental issues to discovering how geospatial supports our everyday and working lives. This year our event brings together community speakers and sponsors who will present a range of subjects on our conference theme “Geospatial Solutions for the Built Environment” and how geospatial technologies are transforming the way we design, build, and manage the built environment, whether its planning, transport, infrastructure or energy. Register your place The conference will be hosted at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff on Thursday 9 th October from 10am – 5pm with an opportunity to network throughout the day and after the conference an opportunity to join the AGI Cymru team for GeoDrinks. If you would like to present as a community speaker or would like to sponsor the event, please contact AGI Member Support on info@agi.org.uk for more information. We hope you can join us for GeoCymru 2025.

description: University of Southampton – GeoData host a number of on demand course, that can be scheduled at your convenience: Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton

title: OpenSource GIS Integration
description: This two-day intensive course introduces you to the core functionality of PostGIS, QGIS, GeoServer and OpenLayers, taking you through all the tools you will need to load, spatially analyse, publish and share geospatial data. This course is designed specifically by Open Source GIS software specialists to demonstrate how to setup and successfully utilise Open Source GIS, spatial databases and web mapping services in an integrated environment. The course is delivered using instructor-led real world examples where you learn by ‘doing’. The course covers topics including, installation and configuration of all software, loading vector data into a spatial database, connecting to a spatial database and then undertaking GIS analysis, manipulating spatial data, publishing and connecting to WMS and WFS services and utilising OpenLayers to explore web mapping capabilities. Find more information and register directly with Arkance

title: QGIS Foundation – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Looking to get started with GIS or gain skills in QGIS? This hands-on, instructor-led course from Idox Geospatial is designed for beginners who want to understand the fundamentals of geographic information systems (GIS) and spatial data analysis. You’ll explore key concepts in GIS, learn how to manage and visualise spatial data, and become confident using QGIS tools and workflows. The course also covers basic database theory and practical techniques for real-world applications. Whether you’re working in environmental science, urban planning, local government, or any data-driven field, this is the perfect entry point into the world of open-source GIS. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. If you’re looking for custom GIS training or an on-site GIS course, please contact hello-geo@idoxgroup.com to discuss your requirements.

title: QGIS: Introduction to Coastal and Marine GIS
description: Delivering sustainable development in the marine environment requires a balance to be achieved between resource use and protection of our seas. Spatial data is increasingly important in such decision-making being used for marine planning, conflict management and environmental management. GeoData’s experienced GIS trainers have teamed up with ABPmer GIS Consultants, who specialise in the coastal and marine sector, to create a course that will provide you with the background and skills necessary to utilise these powerful tools and techniques. The course introduces GIS concepts and techniques using QGIS and is intended for those who have little to no GIS knowledge or who wish to undertake some formalized training in QGIS having been largely self-taught in the past. A project showcase, drawn from ABPmer’s portfolio, illustrates how spatial data has been used within GIS to support coastal and marine decision making.  The course also considers common problems faced when mapping the coastal and offshore zones (including projections, vertical datums, etc.) Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton

title: BIM-GIS Integration for Architecture, Engineering & Construction
description: Two-day virtual course (£995) on integrating BIM and GIS using ArcGIS Pro. A mixture of theory and hands-on. Day 1: BIM and Information Management Concepts and Principals Day 2: Practical Hands-On ArcGIS training for BIM and GIS For AEC professionals with basic ArcGIS Pro skills. Includes 10 CPD points. Find more information and register directly with Esri UK

title: ArcGIS Pro Intermediate – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Take your GIS skills to the next level with Idox Geospatial’s ArcGIS Pro Intermediate training course – perfect for users who already understand the basics and are ready to tackle more advanced geospatial tasks. This hands-on course covers key techniques such as repairing broken data sources, managing domains and subtypes, loading data into feature classes, and customizing attribute tables. You’ll learn to summarise spatial data, create advanced symbology and labels, work with multiple data frames, and design publication-ready layouts. The course also dives into powerful spatial analysis tools like buffer, clip, union, and intersect, along with advanced editing workflows using tools like reshape, trim, mirror, and modify – helping you build real proficiency in ArcGIS Pro for professional applications. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. If you’re looking for custom GIS training or an on-site GIS course, please contact hello-geo@idoxgroup.com to discuss your requirements.

title: MapInfo Advanced Level Course
description: The advanced course is designed to develop the user’s knowledge of MapInfo beyond the simple definition of the commands. The intention is to aid the student in using MapInfo to develop effective analysis and reporting techniques through hands-on use of the software. The course is aimed specifically at users who will be responsible for the management of a MapInfo installation, and those responsible for interpreting requirements for operations in order to develop applications. title: Introduction to ArcGIS Pro Online
description: This course introduces the underlying principles and methods of Geographical Information Systems (GIS). It examines the processes involved in the capture, storage, manipulation, analysis, presentation and output of digital geographical data in a GIS and provides opportunities for the development of practical skills in processing data using an industry standard GIS software package. Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton .

title: FME Form Introductory Training - Family Friendly Option
description: This course is Avineon Tensing’s way of saying “Welcome to the FME Platform”, your journey starts with FME Form (previously FME Desktop) where all your automations are authored. Visual programming is at the heart of Data Integration, so let Avineon Tensing’s Certified FME Trainer guide your understanding of the FME tools and capabilities. On our FME Form Introductory course we take you from zero to data hero, introducing you to the fundamentals and concepts of FME Workbench, the FME Data Inspector and the Quick Translator from the word go. We focus on the settings that are vital to be efficient, and the best approach to build excellent Workspaces that you and your team can be proud of. Unsurprisingly, Transformers, the tools that process your data, get plenty of airtime. We show you how to add them to your canvas, slick ways to use them and of course, we’ll help you understand which one to use next. With so much data out there for you to process, we’ve also built our content around unique custom European and UK-based examples, that we use in our courses to give you a local context. We use this data so you can see how to read and write it effectively and make new integrations, and of course, all wrapped up with our best practice techniques and tips and tricks to help you be efficient quickly. Our Certified FME Trainers in the UK are David Eagle and Simon Green and they’ve both got 15+ years of experience with the FME Platform, data integration, GIS analysis and of course, they’ve been delivering software training for most of their careers, so you’re definitely in a ‘Safe’ pair of hands. Find out more and register for the next course with Avineon Tensing .

title: Cadcorp SIS Desktop Administration
description: This course will enable a Cadcorp SIS user to administer the product and its associated files and manage the GIS data for their organisation. The content builds upon Day 2 of the Introduction to Cadcorp SIS Desktop course. System Administrators will learn how to export data into useful GIS file formats and about the best-performing formats for Cadcorp SIS. Find more information and register directly with Cadcorp

title: AGI 3D Network Event - Save the Date
description: Inaugural AGI 3D Network event. Community event to raise awareness of the 3D Network aims and objectives The workshop will include various presentations and activities that will support these objectives. The 3d Network event will coincide and align with the UK Digital Twin Conference happening in Nottingham on the 11th – 12th November. Save the date more details to follow!

title: ArcGIS Pro Foundation – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Designed for beginners, this hands-on ArcGIS Pro training course from Idox Geospatial introduces essential GIS concepts, spatial data analysis, map creation, and geoprocessing tools using ESRI’s powerful desktop software. Whether you’re a student, professional, or simply curious about GIS, this instructor-led course will guide you step-by-step through the fundamentals—no prior experience needed. You’ll learn how to navigate ArcGIS Pro, work with spatial data, create high-quality maps, and perform basic geospatial analysis. Perfect for anyone looking to build practical GIS skills, this course provides a solid foundation and the confidence to apply ArcGIS Pro in real-world scenarios. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. If you’re looking for custom GIS training or an on-site GIS course, please contact hello-geo@idoxgroup.com to discuss your requirements.

description: Join us and fellow GIS professionals to discover the very best in Welsh geospatial innovation, gain new insight, share best practices and learn about the latest in GIS technology. The day provides a unique opportunity to mix and network with the Welsh GIS community and meet Esri experts as we delve into this years theme ‘GIS — Uniting our World’. Find more information and register directly with Esri UK

title: Introduction to ArcGIS Online (AGOL)
description: This practical, one-day hands-on course provides a guided introduction to the workflow in ArcGIS Online (AGOL) for uploading and sharing your spatial data. You will learn how to publish existing vector data to AGOL, create views, set sharing and group privileges, create a web map that drives data collection and forms the foundation to an Experience Builder web application. The course comprises hands-on exercises each introduced with a short presentation and a live demonstration. Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton.

title: SAVE THE DATE - AGI Early Careers Network and GGP Rising Stars Webinar
description: Save the date for spotlight webinar on AGI ECN and GGP – Rising Stars More details to follow shortly

title: FME Form Introductory Training
description: Learn from the experts how to use the essential components and capabilities in FME through personal tuition in this two-day course, which includes extensive hands-on, problem-solving exercises. This course is suitable for you if: Find more information and register directly with 1Spatial

title: ArcGIS Modelbuilder (ArcGIS Pro) Online
description: This practical, one-day hands-on course provides an introduction to ArcGIS Pro model builder and how you can use it to streamline data processing tasks. You will be introduced to GeoProcessing Toolbox and gain a deeper understanding of ArcPro geoprocessing tools. You will learn how to construct a model, make it loop, expose parameters to turn it into a Model tool for embedding and integrating Python scripts into the model builder environment. The course comprises hands-on exercises each introduced with a short presentation. Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton.

title: AGI Foresight Project 2030
description: The AGI Foresight 2030 Project will consider the biggest trends and themes impacting the geographic information sector over the next 5 years. The views and experiences of a wide range of stakeholders have been collated and analysed, culminating in an independent summary of the most significant future influences on the industry, wider society, and the physical, economic and political environments. The project report will be published, and formally launched at this event. Save the date and join us at the Royal Geographic Society (with IBG) in London on the 13th November 2025.

title: University of Southampton - GeoData On Demand Training
description: University of Southampton – GeoData host a number of on demand course, that can be scheduled at your convenience: Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton

title: Introduction to GeoServer
description: This two-day intensive course introduces you to the core functionality of GeoServer, taking you through all the tools you will need to load, publish and share geospatial data. GeoServer is an Open Source software server designed for interoperability; publishing data from any major spatial data source using open standards, allowing users to share and edit geospatial data. The course is delivered using instructor-led real world examples where you learn by ‘doing’. The course covers topics including, installation and configuration, familiarisation of the GeoServer user interface, publishing raster and vector data, map styling with SLD, applying attribute and spatial filters, connecting to WMS, WFS services and tile caching with GeoWebCache. Find more information and register directly with Arkance

title: QGIS Intermediate – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Advance your GIS expertise with hands-on QGIS Intermediate Training from Idox Geospatial, perfect for professionals in environmental consultancy, planning, engineering, utilities, and local government. Designed for users with basic QGIS experience, this one-day course deepens your skills in spatial data analysis, advanced map styling, and workflow optimisation using real-world datasets. Boost your ability to manage metadata, spatial databases, and file formats while creating high-quality, decision-ready maps. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. If you’re looking for custom GIS training or an on-site GIS course, please contact hello-geo@idoxgroup.com to discuss your requirements.

title: MapInfo Foundation Level Course
description: The foundation course is designed for people who will be using MapInfo on a day to day basis. The focus of the course is on basic operations, and how to find, and use, the MapInfo tools to carry them out. The course is designed as a series of modules covering different aspects of MapInfo use, and each session will use a worked example for the delegates to follow on their own PCs. Find more information and register directly with CDR Group

description: Discover how location data unlocks insight and better decision-making in the public sector. title: ArcGIS Pro Intermediate – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Take your GIS skills to the next level with Idox Geospatial’s ArcGIS Pro Intermediate training course – perfect for users who already understand the basics and are ready to tackle more advanced geospatial tasks. This hands-on course covers key techniques such as repairing broken data sources, managing domains and subtypes, loading data into feature classes, and customizing attribute tables. You’ll learn to summarise spatial data, create advanced symbology and labels, work with multiple data frames, and design publication-ready layouts. The course also dives into powerful spatial analysis tools like buffer, clip, union, and intersect, along with advanced editing workflows using tools like reshape, trim, mirror, and modify – helping you build real proficiency in ArcGIS Pro for professional applications. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. title: The Geospatial Leadership Certificate (GLC)
description: The Global Leadership Certificate (GLC) – is a unique leadership training course designed specifically for Geospatial practitioners. Module 1: Leadership Module 2: Team Building Module 3: Building The Business Case for Investments Module 4: Influencing Decision Makers Module 5: Project Management Module 6: Marketing Strategy and Planning Module 7: Sustainable Business Models Module 8: Governance and Policy Module 9: Basic Sales Techniques The webinar will be delivered by Andrew Coote, CEO and Harry Storer, Director of Strategy at ConsultingWhere.  Both have long careers in management across the globe and in many different economic sectors. We have collaborated with a series of industry experts to create this course to ensure maximum access to insightful and practical solutions. Find more information by visiting ConsultingWhere website or contact Andrew directly on info@consultingwhere.com

title: Cadcorp SIS & Ordnance Survey GB Data
description: This course introduces students to Ordnance Survey ® (OS ® ) data using Cadcorp SIS. It provides an insight into accessing and managing the OS GB major datasets. You will explore how to use Cadcorp SIS Desktop for data management – to process the various OS datasets such as ZoomStack, Mastermap, Open Greenspaces etc. In addition, you will gain an understanding of how to access the OS Data Hub from within SIS Desktop and SIS WebMap using Web Map Services and OS API keys. Find more information and register directly with Cadcorp .

title: QGIS: Introductory Online
description: This course introduces the underlying principles and methods of Geographical Information Systems (GIS). It examines the processes involved in the capture, storage, manipulation, analysis, presentation and output of digital geographical data in a GIS and provides opportunities for the development of practical skills in processing data using a leading Open Source GIS software package, QGIS. Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton.

title: FME Form Advanced Training - Family Friendly Option
description: This course offers you Avineon Tensing’s deep dive into FME. Designed for the seasoned data professional and existing FME Form (previously FME Desktop) user, our Certified FME Trainers will guide you to the peak of data integration. We’ll focus on advanced data management techniques, efficiency, performance and best practice. On our FME Form Advanced course, we help to move you towards being an FME power user. We’ll even advise you on becoming a Certified FME Professional if you want to use this course as a stepping stone to helping you achieve personal accreditation. Our trainers will equip you with the skills you’ll need to ensure the automation processes you build, can utilise the best-practice techniques and new features you’ll need for the next stage of your data integration journey. We cover advanced attribute management and manipulation; an important skill when so much of our data has strings that need altering or checking! We help you hone your Workspace design skills, to improve the performance of your production tasks, whilst also making your more involved Workspaces easier to maintain. We also cover plenty of advanced parameter functionality to help give your processes the ability to multi-task. You’ll also have a nice takeaway tool in the form of a custom transformer you’ll build, to interact with a useful UK hosted API. With so much data out there for you to process, we’ve also built our content around unique custom European and UK-based examples, that we use in our courses to give you a local context. Our Certified FME Trainers in the UK are David Eagle and Simon Green and they’ve both got 15+ years of experience with the FME Platform, data integration, GIS analysis and of course, they’ve been delivering software training for most of their careers, so you’re definitely in a ‘Safe’ pair of hands. Find out more and register for the next course with Avineon Tensing .

title: QGIS Foundation – Instructor-led GIS training course (virtual)
description: Looking to get started with GIS or gain skills in QGIS? This hands-on, instructor-led course from Idox Geospatial is designed for beginners who want to understand the fundamentals of geographic information systems (GIS) and spatial data analysis. You’ll explore key concepts in GIS, learn how to manage and visualise spatial data, and become confident using QGIS tools and workflows. The course also covers basic database theory and practical techniques for real-world applications. Whether you’re working in environmental science, urban planning, local government, or any data-driven field, this is the perfect entry point into the world of open-source GIS. Learn more and book your place here In addition to our scheduled GIS training courses, our expert instructors can also deliver training at a suitable venue and location of your choice, on a date that suits your team. We also provide bespoke GIS training courses tailored to your specific needs. If you’re looking for custom GIS training or an on-site GIS course, please contact hello-geo@idoxgroup.com to discuss your requirements.

title: Advanced QGIS
description: This classroom based course builds on the delegates existing knowledge of QGIS. It comprises a series of presentations, demos and computer practical sessions using FREE open source GIS software. The example datasets are taken from a variety of fields. Delegates are introduced to advanced analysis techniques using both raster and vector data. The course includes a basic introduction to the PostgresSQL/PostGIS Find more information and register directly with GeoData, University of Southampton

title: FME Flow Authoring Training
description: This course is Avineon Tensing’s focus on ‘enterprise’ data integration and will help you get started, or formalise your understanding of FME Flow (previously FME Server). When your needs extend beyond the desktop, FME Flow is your application of choice to enable enterprise automation. We will introduce you to scheduling, webhooks, automations, event-driven notifications and much more! On our FME Flow Authoring course we take your skills into the world of Enterprise data integration, linking up your existing experience with FME Form, to its enterprise companion. We introduce you to the complete user interface and we’ll of course discuss deployment options too, to ensure you start off on the right foot. Processing power matters, so managing your engine capacity, standard and consumption-based credit is a key part of the course. We’ll make sure you can publish your Workspaces, host them, run them and register them with the right service. So whether you’re interested in self-service data automation, task scheduling or real-time data processing… this is the course for you. With so much data out there for you to process, we’ve also built our content around unique custom European and UK-based examples, that we use in our courses to give you a local context. We use this data so you can see how to read and write it effectively and make new integrations, and of course, all wrapped up with our best practice techniques and tips and tricks to help you be efficient quickly. Our Certified FME Trainers in the UK are David Eagle and Simon Green and they’ve both got 15+ years of experience with the FME Platform, data integration, GIS analysis and of course, they’ve been delivering software training for most of their careers, so you’re definitely in a ‘Safe’ pair of hands. Find out more and register for the next course with Avineon Tensing .

title: Esri UK Annual Conference 2026 - Save the Date
description: Save the date for the UK’s largest GIS event showcasing the very best in geospatial solutions, user success stories and technology demonstrations. Registration opens in early 2026. Find more information Esri UK

title: CMIP Community Workshop 2026
description: The CMIP Community Workshop 2026 brings together Earth system scientists, partners, and stakeholders to discuss the latest developments in Earth system and coupled modelling. The workshop will explore CMIP6 analyses, early results from CMIP7 simulations, new experimental designs, observation-modelling interfaces, and strategies for delivering high-quality climate information. Opportunities for networking, collaboration, and an Early-Career Scientist workshop are also included.
category_string: Climate Science; Earth System Modelling; Research; Networking; CMIP
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to receive communications from CMIP 2026 organizers.

title: ECSA 2026 Conference
description: Join the 6th European Citizen Science Association (ECSA) Conference in Oulu, Finland, exploring 'Citizen Science between Centre and Periphery'. Participate in panels, workshops, roundtables, and the Citizen Science Festival, engaging with researchers, activists, policymakers, and the public to advance citizen science and participatory research.
category_string: Citizen Science; Research; Sustainability; Community Engagement; Innovation
audience: General public interested in citizen science
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to receive communications from ECSA 2026 organizers.

title: Protecting Our Planet Day 2025 (POP25)
description: Protecting Our Planet Day (POP) is an inspiring live-streamed event for schools, organized by the UK Space Education Office (ESERO-UK) at STEM Learning in collaboration with the European Space Agency and the UK Space Agency. POP25 will feature expert speakers and researchers sharing insights on protecting our planet from Earth and space.
audience: Educators interested in STEM and space
Anyone interested in environmental protection and space science
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to receive communications from ESERO-UK and POP organizers.

title: 11th EARSeL Workshop on Land Ice and Snow 2026
description: The 11th EARSeL Workshop on Land Ice and Snow will be held in Kumpula, Helsinki, Finland, at the Finnish Meteorological Institute (FMI). The workshop focuses on land ice and snow research, with sessions, keynote speakers, workshops, and social events. Abstract submission is open until 15 September 2025.
location: Finnish Meteorological Institute, Kumpula, Helsinki, Finland
category_string: Remote Sensing; Climate; Land Ice; Snow; Workshop; Research
audience: Academics and students interested in land ice and snow studies
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to receive communications from EARSeL.

title: Climate Adaptation in Agronomy with Satellite Technology
description: Learn how satellite technology can help farmers adapt to climate change in this online event. Presentations and panel discussions will cover satellite imagery applications, IoT sensors, digital farm data management, and interactive Q&A with experts from Pixalytics Ltd, ADAS, Lacuna Space, and Ceres Research.
category_string: Science & Tech; High Tech; Climate; Agronomy; Satellite Technology; Resilience
audience: Policy makers and funders in agri-tech
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to receive communications from the event organizers.

title: European Congress on Climate Change and Environmental Sustainability
description: A global gathering of climate scientists, environmental experts, policymakers, and industry professionals to discuss climate change, sustainability, and innovative solutions. Participants will engage in keynote presentations, workshops, panel discussions, and networking opportunities.
location: NH Vienna Airport Conference Center, 1-3 Einfahrts Str., 1300 Schwechat, Vienna, Austria
category_string: Climate Change; Environmental Sustainability; Research; Innovation
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to C2P Forum communications and newsletter subscription.

title: Focus on Finance – Ponder, Pitch and Partner
description: With a keynote address from Louisa Burwood-Taylor, Head of Media and Research at AgFunder, and presentations from representatives from public and private investment, this event provides opportunities for one-to-one meetings with investors, learning about funding strategies, and understanding the UK agri-tech investment landscape.
location: Storey’s Field Centre, Eddington Avenue, Cambridge, CB3 1AA, United Kingdom
audience: Tech developers and business leaders needing finance
Researchers and entrepreneurs seeking first investments
Delegates interested in UK agri-tech finance
consent_notes: By registering, participants agree to Agri-TechE communications and newsletter subscription.

title: Global Sustainable Islands Summit 2026
description: The Global Sustainable Islands Summit 2026 brings together island leaders, innovators, and sustainability champions from around the world to shape the future of sustainable island development. The event includes presentations, workshops, and networking opportunities focused on climate adaptation, renewable energy, responsible tourism, and resilient island communities.
organizer: Island Innovation & Cabildo de Gran Canaria
consent_notes: Participants agree to be contacted by Island Innovation and selected third parties and to receive newsletters.

title: Virtual Island Summit 2025 – 7th Anniversary
description: The Virtual Island Summit 2025 is a global online conference connecting island communities worldwide to share knowledge, best practices, and innovative solutions for sustainable, resilient, and prosperous islands. The summit includes interactive sessions, five content tracks, and speakers from over 100 island communities.
consent_notes: Participants agree to receive communications from Island Innovation and selected third parties. All sessions are free of charge.

title: Launch of Britain Talks Climate & Nature Research
description: Climate Outreach and More in Common present the official launch of the updated Britain Talks Climate & Nature research, exploring how British people think and feel about climate change and nature in 2025. The webinar will provide insights for communicators and leaders on engaging across society, with presentations from the research team and a Q&A session. Funded by the European Climate Foundation.
category_string: Climate; Nature; Public Engagement; Research; Communication
consent_notes: Event will include presentations and Q&A. Registration required.

title: Trustworthy Climate Information for Effective Physical Climate Risk Assessment: Challenges and Solutions in Re/Insurance and Finance
description: A two-day invitation-only workshop hosted by Climateurope2, UCL, and the UK Centre for Greening Finance and Investment (CGFI), focusing on the trustworthiness, quality, and regulation of climate services in the re/insurance and finance sectors. Participants will discuss European standardisation efforts, contribute sector-specific insights, co-design input for regulators, and map climate information needs across sectors. The event will run under Chatham House rules.
location: Conway Hall, 25 Red Lion Square, London, WC1R 4RL, United Kingdom
organizer: Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC), University College London (UCL), UK Centre for Greening Finance and Investment (CGFI)
category_string: Climate; Finance; Reinsurance; Risk; Standardisation; Policy
consent_notes: Invitation-only. Event held under Chatham House rules. Delegate list shared only with participants.

title: Climate Services for Health: Exploring Current Status and the Role of Standardisation
description: An invitation-only, two-day workshop hosted by Climateurope2 and the Barcelona Supercomputing Center, bringing together stakeholders from the climate, health, and humanitarian sectors to address the lack of agreed standards in climate service delivery, engagement, and usability. Discussions will explore practical experiences, emerging opportunities, and contribute to standardisation efforts for climate services in health.
consent_notes: Invitation-only event. Expression of interest required for participation.

title: Climateurope2 Festival 2025 – Belgrade
description: The Climateurope2 Festival 2025, hosted by the Center for the Promotion of Science, brings together experts, policymakers, and innovators to strengthen the climate services community in Eastern Europe. Under the theme 'Empowering society through climate services', the programme covers agriculture, health, Mission Adaptation, and features artistic exhibitions, plenary sessions, interactive workshops, World Café discussions, and a project marketplace.
location: Radisson Collection Hotel, Old Mill Belgrade, Serbia
category_string: Climate; Services; Adaptation; Policy; Innovation; Agriculture; Health
consent_notes: Participation is free but registration is required by September 1, 2025.

title: Land and Water in a Changing Climate
description: A one-day conference hosted by HydroJules at The Royal Society, bringing together the hydrological and land-surface modelling community, industry and practitioners across the UK. The event includes keynote talks, interactive sessions, and networking opportunities with an optional dinner.
location: The Royal Society, 6-9 Carlton House Terrace, London, SW1Y 5AG, United Kingdom
category_string: Hydrology; Climate; Land Use; Environmental Modelling

title: 5th National Climate Impacts & Risks Meeting (NCI-RM)
description: A national meeting hosted by the University of Bristol and the Royal Meteorological Society, bringing together researchers and practitioners to discuss climate impacts, adaptation, and health, with sessions on physical climate changes, industry needs, and climate-health intersections.
location: The Watershed, Canon’s Road, Bristol, United Kingdom
organizer: University of Bristol, Royal Meteorological Society

title: Workshop on Microsystems for Environmental Sensing
description: A cross-sector workshop exploring the role of microsystems in advanced environmental sensing, featuring talks from leading UK researchers and interactive discussions on challenges and opportunities.
location: Elm House, 351 Bristol Road, Birmingham B5 7SW, United Kingdom

title: NetworkNature Annual Event 2025 | Choose Nature
description: The NetworkNature Annual Event 2025 will explore how to align biodiversity and economy in times of urgency, building on the concept of Nature-based Solutions. Stakeholders from public and private sectors will examine ideas, exchange knowledge, explore initiatives, and share case studies linking nature with climate, economy, innovation, finance, business, and wellbeing. The event will also mark the launch of the NbS Business Forum.
location: Bruxelles Environnement, Avenue du Port 86C, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

title: Webinar 1 - Navigating Marine Data: Planning, Stewardship, and the value of MEDIN
description: This webinar introduces marine data stewardship and the MEDIN Framework, covering principles of best practice, data planning, management, and examples such as the Marine Data Exchange. Speakers include Monica Hanley (BODC/NOC) and Harry Richardson (The Crown Estate).

title: Webinar 2 - Interoperability in Action: Data Standards and Marine Applications
description: Focus on MEDIN Marine Data Standards and Guidelines, data interoperability challenges, and applications in ports. Speakers include Allan Jamieson (Ordnance Survey) and Katie Eades (OceanWise).

title: Webinar 3 - Speaking the Same Language: How Controlled Vocabularies Facilitate Data Sharing and Interoperability
description: Covers controlled vocabularies, semantic models, and accessing vocabularies via APIs and SPARQL. Speakers include Danielle Wright and Alexandra Kokkinaki (BODC/NOC).

title: Webinar 4 - Making Marine Data Count: Archiving Biodiversity Data with DASSH and Citing with DOIs
description: Explores archiving biodiversity data with DASSH and using DOIs for citation. Speakers include Chloe Figueroa Ashforth (MBA/DASSH) and James Ayliffe (BODC/NOC).

title: Webinar 5 - Ocean Data at Scale: Autonomous Data Management and High-Volume Archiving at BODC
description: Covers autonomous platform data management (Argo floats, gliders, ALR) and challenges of high-volume data archiving at BODC. Speakers include Robyn Owen, Monica Hanley, and Danielle Wright (BODC/NOC).

title: Webinar 6 - Unlocking Ocean Knowledge: The Global Push for Better Data Sharing

Key discussions will focus on managing satellite constellations, advancing exploration from Low Earth Orbit to Lunar, and achieving an effective Space and Spectrum Situational Awareness (S3A) as a critical element for mission success, security, and sustainability of space radiocommunications systems.

With rapid advancements in the space sector, this Forum is a must-attend event for policymakers, industry leaders, regulators, and space experts committed to the sustainable and responsible use of space.
