Your Volunteer Hosts
Paul Haslam
is passionate about helping to protect the planet’s climate and biodiversity for generations to come. He is the Climate Change Champion for North Yorkshire Council (and NYC councillor for Bilton and Nidd Gorge), and understands the significant impact that SMEs can deliver in this challenge.
Paul is an ESG coach to businesses, helping senior executives understand the implications of ESG reporting and the opportunity of the circular economy in their sector, which then allows them to formulate their own ESG strategy that eventually becomes part of business as usual. As a former FTSE 250 CEO, Paul knows that a business cannot be sustainable without making a profit but highlights the importance of understanding that a business cannot thrive without looking after its people and the planet where much of its resources come from.

title: 2nd International Virtual Recycling Conference 2025
description:
Join us for an enriching experience at the International Virtual Recycling Conference 2025, an online recycling event where you can delve into the latest industry developments, connect with professionals, and gain valuable insights into the future of sustainable energy. Join us on Tuesday, 14 October 2025, from 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM ET.
Our Recycling Meet 2025 Event is your gateway to understanding this dynamic sector, this informative occasion will run for a duration of up to 2 hours, bringing together experts, industry enthusiasts, and thought leaders. The event is designed to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the field.

Your Volunteer Hosts
Alex Duggan
-
REHSQ Ltd
. is an independent Health & Safety and Sustainability Consultancy based in Newbury. They work across a range of diverse industries including trades, manufacturing, commercial, biotech and construction providing a wide range of services. REHSQ are experienced in conducting risk assessments, developing policies and procedures, and ensuring compliance with regulatory standards. REHSQ also specialises in helping businesses integrate environmental, social, and economic sustainability practices into their operations. They are committed to creating a positive impact by guiding clients towards more responsible and resilient business practices and achieving the goal of net zero.
Jim Holland
-
carma
. Jim spent 13 years as a weapons engineer in the Royal Navy before moving into high-level positions in the corporate sector. After losing his job at Manchester Airport Group due to the pandemic, he decided to start his own company. His business focuses on assisting veterans transitioning to civilian life and promoting environmental sustainability, two issues close to his heart. Jim understands the challenges former military personnel face and is dedicated to using his experience to help others navigate this change. He resides in Newbury, Berkshire, with his wife Sally and their four daughters, enjoying the bustle of a big family. Through his work and home life, Jim is passionate about providing support and making a positive impact in the community.

title: People Planet Pint Host: Onboarding & Training
description:
How do you host a great People Planet Pint event? Discover how to host your first event or just get some refresher training!
Welcome to
People Planet Pint Host: Onboarding & Training
!
In this session we'll be talking you through how to run a great People Planet Pint event and guide you through all of the support available.
Welcome and meet other hosts
Before your event
Promoting your event and Canva templates
How to pick a venue
How to submit dates
On the night
How to run a great event
Social media content to capture
After the event
What support we give with Promotion
WhatsApp Groups and how they work
Re-ordering Materials
Q+A
Meet other hosts
Breakout rooms to meet each other, groups of 3/4

Maria Huff has lived in & around Banbury for over 20 years, variously involved in Quakers, Friends of the Earth, Community Action Groups, Extinction Rebellion and the Banbury Acting Together network during that time - and loves having supportive and positive conversations about sustainability, and how we as people need to find our way to it. She's an IT Manager by profession, with a love of fixing and recycling things.
Venue Accessibility
Venue - find us in the back bar!
Accessibility: There is one step in the main entrance to the White Horse. There is step free access via the side lane (on the left as you look from the road), and a back gate on your right. Disabled parking right outside the pub.
Food: there is no food served at the White Horse at the moment, you can bring your own, or order food in if you want.

title: Legal ESG: Europe
description:
ESG is moving from voluntary ambition to mandated action.
As Europe rolls out sweeping new regulations – from the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) to the Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive (CS3D) – businesses face unprecedented obligations to report on sustainability and police their supply chains. At the same time, regulators around the world are ramping up ESG enforcement, and courts are seeing a surge in climate and ESG-related lawsuits.
The question is no longer if companies and their legal advisors should prioritize ESG, but how to do so effectively, in full compliance, and in ways that stand up to scrutiny.
Legal ESG: Europe 2025, taking place on 16th October 2025 at Baker McKenzie’s Paris office, is an opportunity for law firm leaders, in-house counsel, compliance professionals, and ESG experts to come together, learn from each other, and drive the ESG agenda forward. It’s a chance to reflect on the progress made so far, confront the challenges on the horizon, and commit to a future where ESG is a fundamental element of corporate strategy and legal practice. Join us to exchange ideas, prepare for what’s next, and ensure that your organization is ready for this new chapter of ESG.
Discussions Will Include
How will new EU directives like CSRD and CS3D reshape corporate accountability and legal risk?
Are companies prepared to meet stringent ESG reporting requirements and conduct due diligence across global supply chains?
What do rising climate lawsuits and greenwashing crackdowns mean for businesses and their counsel?
How are regulators and investors globally enforcing ESG commitments and holding organizations accountable?
How is the era of ESG accountability impacting corporate governance and the responsibilities of boards and legal advisors?
How can legal and compliance teams proactively mitigate ESG risks while driving sustainable value for their organizations?
Confirm your place by July 31st and save $300
Register here: https://www.insidepractice.com/legal-esg-europe-2025
location:
BakerMckenzie Paris, 1 Rue Paul Baudry,
75008 Paris,
France

, a new business consultancy that helps Agencies, Consultancies and purpose-driven B2B companies to grow their business. We launched with the aim of creating a more productive, remote-working environment, contributing to a lower-carbon business culture, and a more positive employee work-life balance. 10 years on, and we now have an increased focus on people and planet-driven initiatives. Our activities include membership to the Better Business Network, supporting the Better Business Act, carbon footprint offsetting via SKOOT (a B-Corp) and membership to 1% For The Planet. We have a long-standing relationship with Neo, and have supported them over the years with their new business outreach and engagement.
Kelly Smith
co-runs
Neo
, one of the first certified B Corps in the UK and a member of the Better Business Network. Neo was also one of the few original purposeful creative agencies, having dedicated itself from day one to working exclusively on projects with social and environmental purpose.
Through their partnership with Bluestone B2B, the Neo team want to help more sustainable and ethical businesses build their success around positive change.
Kelly’s commitment to purposeful work and love for language is matched only by her passion for beer. Many years ago, before Kelly moved to Brighton and joined Neo as strategic & creative partner, she worked as a drinks industry journalist and brewery PR. Don’t get her started on the price of a pint…

Caeryn Collins - My view is that the real (magic) happened when I put my own values on the business. We are also launching the RGB Rebels Club which is a Bi-monthly meeting in partnership with Wigan and Leigh College.
I regularly support other local businesses, Social Enterprises, charities and the councils in the areas we work in. title: Bromley - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Angela Hulm
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Greener and Cleaner, High St,
Bromley BR1,
UK

title: Sustainability Europe 2025
description:
In 2025 the corporate sustainability landscape is defined by regulatory uncertainty, unchartered climate risk and geopolitical shocks. The threat of deregulation compounded with the increased scrutiny on the commercial value of sustainability investments translates into real-world impact across complex global supply chains. Sustainability professionals are overrun, facing hurdles in data management, struggling with scalability, and navigating swings in trends.

With only 5 years until 2030, corporations are at a major inflection point. Interpreting unclear regulations, building compelling business cases and managing intricate supply chains effectively while addressing complex data challenges is paramount to future success. Developing a proactive approach and moving beyond compliance-driven reporting will be difficult and cannot be done alone.

Sustainability Europe 2025 offers you a unique opportunity to meet the moment and directly address these challenges. Join 500+ senior corporate executives as we provide practical strategies to navigate regulatory overload, build financially sound sustainability arguments, and drive real action. Through peer-to-peer roundtables, expert panels, and insightful fireside chats, you will gain clarity, create valuable networks, and acquire actionable tools to thrive in this evolving landscape. Attending will give you the tools to drive meaningful, value-creating sustainability strategies within your organisation.

For the past 24 years this, our flagship European event, has outlined the latest trends, tactics and opportunities in sustainable business. Join us at this critical juncture in October as we drive sustainable action and deliver corporate value.
location:
Convene 155 Bishopsgate Liverpool Street, 155 Bishopsgate,
London EC2M 3YD,
UK

title: Become a People Planet Pint Host!
description:
What does Hosting a People Planet Pint mean? Explore the ways you can get involved and host a much loved event series in this webinar
In this informative session, you will learn about the mission and vision of People Planet Pint, our achievements so far, and how you can benefit from becoming a host. We will discuss the various hosting opportunities available, the impact your support can have on our community initiatives, and the mutual benefits of this partnership.
Key Topics Covered:
Introduction to People Planet Pint: Our story, mission, and values.
The impact of our community initiatives on a local and global level
Sponsorship opportunities: Different levels of sponsorship and the benefits associated with each.
Q&A session: Get all your questions answered by our team and make an informed decision about joining us as a host.
Why Host People Planet Pint?
People Planet Pint
(PPP)
is more than just a series of informal meetups—it's a growing, vibrant
national network of sustainability-minded professionals, entrepreneurs, and changemakers
.
With over 100 active locations across the UK and beyond, PPP brings together individuals who care deeply about creating a better future for people and the planet.
1.
Authentic Brand Alignment with Sustainability
Our attendees aren't just passive listeners—they are
action-oriented individuals
working in sustainability, community organisations, clean tech, ethical business, and climate policy.
Your support places you
at the heart of real climate conversations
happening in local pubs, co-working spaces, and community hubs across the country.
2.
Engage With a High-Quality, Values-Driven Audience
Our community includes:
Sustainability professionals
Small business owners
Innovators and startup founders
Local government and NGO representatives
Sponsors get access to this
valuable, engaged, and passionate network
—a unique blend of grassroots and professional spheres.
3.
Hyperlocal and Scalable Reach
With events happening regularly in dozens of cities and towns, you have local impact and are part of an international movement of change.
4.
Positive Brand Visibility—Without the Greenwash
Unlike traditional event sponsorships, PPP is intentionally
non-corporate and community-led
, creating a trusted environment where you are a supportive partner through grass roots organisations. This builds long-term trust and awareness
location:
1 Mill Street | Coworking Space, 1 Mill St,
Royal Leamington Spa,
Leamington Spa CV31 1ES,
UK

title: Belfast - People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Hello! I am
Bryony
a business owner and a mum to three and a sausage dog owner. (Ben)I am passionate about change. I wish to leave a legacy for my children, “Our Planet,” and raise climate awareness through conversations.

title: Carbon Literacy for the Sport Sector
description:
Sporting Giants' Carbon Literacy training for the sport sector is tailored with additional resources and expertise to meet the unique needs of international and national sports federations, organisations in the sports and sponsorship sectors, and Olympic committees worldwide.
Join us for two 4-hour sessions on Wednesday 5th and Thursday 6th November 9.30am to 1.30pm (BST) online, via Teams.
Our mission is to provide the knowledge, tools, and support required to empower organisations to integrate sustainability into their operations and inspire the broader sports ecosystem to act on climate issues. Through this certified, accredited training, participants gain the confidence and resources to create meaningful environmental change. Carbon Literate employees have the knowledge and understanding to truly engage and contribute to organisations’ sustainability strategies and activities.
We are a hand-picked team of proven leaders and change-makers in sport, strategy and sustainability.
Industry expertise: With a team of seasoned professionals, we bring unmatched insights into the unique challenges and opportunities of the sports sector.
Tailored programmes: Every training session is customised to meet the specific needs and goals of your organisation.
Proven results: Our track record includes successful partnerships with leading sports organisations, helping them achieve measurable sustainability outcomes.
Recognised standards: Aligned with the Carbon Literacy Project, our training meets internationally recognised benchmarks for quality and impact. Certified by the CLP upon successful completion of the course.
We offer a unique experience to those seeking Carbon Literacy training, including access to our ever-growing virtual Sporting Giants Carbon Resource Centre as well as following up with learners after training to support and encourage their carbon reduction journey.

title: Barcelona - Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Venue: Bar La Querida
[English below]
¿Te interesa la sostenibilidad? ¿Quieres conocer y hablar con otra gente interesada en ella? Acércate al próximo People, Planet, Pint y podrás crear nuevas conexiones con gente a la que también le preocupa cuidar del planeta.
No hay agenda, no es un taller ni una charla. Simplemente nos juntamos para tomar algo una vez al mes y conectamos con otras personas a las que les interesa la sostenibilidad, intercambiamos ideas, creamos nuevas conexiones o comentamos temas de actualidad. ¡Dejamos que la conversación y la tarde nos lleven adonde quieran!
Todos impactamos el medio ambiente de una manera u otra, así que ven y aprende cómo puedes tomar acción para un futuro más sostenible en tu comunidad.
Al fin y al cabo, para crear un futuro sostenible necesitamos comunidades unidas y conectadas entre ellas, y ¿qué mejor manera de conectar que tomando algo? Las primeras 10 personas tienen bebida gratis, cortesía de nuestro sponsor :)

Your Volunteer Hosts
Silvia de la Cruz
Silvia is a sustainability strategist and seasoned ecommerce professional with a passion for making a positive impact. She's focused on helping companies effectively communicate and market their sustainability initiatives to drive meaningful change. She loves the ocean, sharks and whales particularly, and does scuba and freediving when she can.
Ash Woodhall
made Catalonia his home in 2018, moving from Sheffield, England after a year of travel in Latin America. He is defined by his warm heart, friendly approach to life, and occasional sense of dark British humour.
Ash enjoys co-hosting the Barcelona People Planet Pint event so he can learn and meet people with similar interests. For work, he runs a micro-company,
Practical Infosec
, supporting positive-impact organisations by helping them stay safe online.
For fun, you can find him pretending to be a coffee barista at home, writing his personal blog, watching Liverpool FC (usually not) win the league, trying to run his first half-marathon, or getting his ass kicked at chess.
Jo-Anne Godden
Jo is a circularity expert committed to positive change to the textile industry. She has purposefully led
RubyMoon
, a sustainable fashion company whilst investigating textile recycling & helping women entrepreneurs. Originally from Brighton, Jo has launched RubyLab in Barcelona: dedicated to circular textile innovation. Jo loves sea swimming and also organises year-round "Full Moon Swims."

Your Volunteer Hosts
Claire Zwozny-Bestwick
: I'm often introduced as my business name ‘CRZyBest’ and that's great, because I am Claire R. Zwozny-Bestwick. I’m a non-traditional, eco-friendly Silversmith & Sculptor, working from my CRZyBest Shedquarters in Derby, creating tiny sculptures in metal clay and turning them into jewellery and accessories. Ensuring our world is a happy place is really important to me, so when making CRZyBest creations I always try my best to look after my customers and our planet too, which is why I make every effort to source my energy, tools and materials from sustainable and ethical sources. Before starting my business, I was a teacher for 20 years and I still very much enjoy supporting others in their businesses, creativity and sustainability journey. I’m a massive advocate of collaboration over competition and my favourite things to make are inspired by dogs and beer, so when I’m not creating in my Shedquarters, you can find me walking my dog or sharing stories with people in my favourite pub, so what better next step than to start hosting ‘People, Planet, Pint’ in The Flowerpot!

are an award-winning, 100% renewably powered web hosting provider, with datacentres in the UK, US, & Europe. They are climate positive, and their approach centres on value, quality and transparency.

title: Harrogate - Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Pop down to your local
People Planet Pint
meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved.
No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s.
Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally.
We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas.
Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink?
Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to ‘
People Planet Pastry
’! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability.
Your Volunteer Hosts
Paul Haslam
is passionate about helping to protect the planet’s climate and biodiversity for generations to come. He is the Climate Change Champion for North Yorkshire Council (and NYC councillor for Bilton and Nidd Gorge), and understands the significant impact that SMEs can deliver in this challenge.
Paul is an ESG coach to businesses, helping senior executives understand the implications of ESG reporting and the opportunity of the circular economy in their sector, which then allows them to formulate their own ESG strategy that eventually becomes part of business as usual. As a former FTSE 250 CEO, Paul knows that a business cannot be sustainable without making a profit but highlights the importance of understanding that a business cannot thrive without looking after its people and the planet where much of its resources come from.
Our Sponsor
KRYSTAL
are an award-winning, 100% renewably powered web hosting, with datacentres in the UK, US, & Europe. They are climate positive, and their approach centres on value, quality and transparency.
We are delighted to announce our partnership with Krystal (the UK's only B Corp web hosting/cloud provider), and welcome them on board as sponsors of the People, Planet, Pint events.
This means
the first 10 drinks
are on Krystal at every event, and has allowed us to invest and upscale the series to accelerate action on climate change.
Simon Blackler
is the founder of
KRYSTAL
, and Co-Founder of
MillionTreePledge
.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
location:
Starling, 47 Oxford St,
Harrogate HG1 1PW,
UK

Your Volunteer Host
Matt
from
Scoop & Scales
is your host. Scoop and Scales is a cooperative that offers refill services to its members and the wider community. The shop, which opened in Macclesfield in October 2020, aims to reduce food waste and the use of single-use packaging. Additionally, it provides a space where people can buy ethically sourced products and minimise their impact on the environment. They also support people to adapt their behaviour and put on lots of events to spread the word locally.
Our speaker this month is Ian Ray from Elov and Elov Community.
Elov
is a community-based project focussing on bike use in the local area. Run by Ian Ray and Russ Hope, their offering is three-fold: they move goods by bike; they repair and sell pre-loved bikes; and they promote the use of bikes.

title: 3rd Global Nano and Materials Congress
description:
Welcome to GNMC2025 – 3rd Global Nano & Materials Congress to be held on November 17–18, 2025 in Amsterdam, Netherlands.

We are excited to welcome you to GNMC2025, a premier international forum bringing together researchers, industry experts, and academics to explore the future of nanotechnology and advanced materials.

This two-day event includes plenary talks, keynotes, research and poster sessions on nanomaterials, energy, Nano-biotech, smart materials, and sustainability. Workshops and exhibitions are also encouraged to highlight innovations and specialized topics.

Join us in Amsterdam to share ideas, discover innovations, and build lasting global connections in a collaborative setting. We look forward to your participation in this transformative gathering!

title: Bromley - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Angela Hulm
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Greener and Cleaner, High St,
Bromley BR1,
UK

Your Volunteer Hosts
Stephanie Lambert
has 20+ years in the private sector, largely in marketing consulting roles working with fast-moving consumer goods globally and in the UK. She's on the board of an environmental charity, served as founding member for a global sustainability industry coalition, and is currently pursuing her masters in business & sustainability at UCL. She's lived in St Albans for ten years and spends most of her spare time hanging out with her young family.
Rondi Allan
is a Co-founder and Director of
Sustainable X
, an award-winning UK sustainability consultancy. She has 20+ years’ experience working in global businesses in the private sector. She is a mentor at the ICRS and a Board Advisor at the Global Chamber of Commerce. A former Chartered Accountant, she is passionate about aligning business with sustainability goals and has a proven record of enabling businesses to thrive while making a positive impact. She has lived in St Albans for almost 20 years and when not taxiing her children, loves volunteering and being part of community activities.
Matt Bourn
leads communications for the Advertising Association which includes steering the UK advertising industry’s work around Climate Action through the global initiative, Ad Net Zero. He is co-author of a new book called Sustainable Advertising which is published by Kogan Page in March 2024. He lives in St Albans, enjoys the city for everything it offers to family and friends, and wishes to see it quickly embrace all things sustainable for the many benefits that can bring.

title: People Planet Pint Host: Onboarding & Training
description:
How do you host a great People Planet Pint event? Discover how to host your first event or just get some refresher training!
Welcome to
People Planet Pint Host: Onboarding & Training
!
In this session we'll be talking you through how to run a great People Planet Pint event and guide you through all of the support available.
Welcome and meet other hosts
Before your event
Promoting your event and Canva templates
How to pick a venue
How to submit dates
On the night
How to run a great event
Social media content to capture
After the event

Breakout rooms to meet each other, groups of 3/4

title: Hampstead- Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Pop down to your local
People Planet Pint
meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved.
No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s.
Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally.
We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas.
Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink?
Your Volunteer Hosts
Sam and Ryan from the
Eden Greenspace.
The Eden Greenspace platform allows businesses to support the world's most effective nature-based solutions, including carbon removal, biodiversity restoration and ocean plastic removal projects.
Strongly against all forms of greenwashing, none of Eden's projects buy or sell carbon credits. Instead, all its projects are personally audited and chosen in line with the UN Environment Programme triple planetary crisis framework, providing a quantified, holistic approach to restore our planet.
By becoming Eden Certified, Eden allows businesses to demonstrate their commitment to sustainability action beyond their value chain, boost their brand image and engage their employees with our 'project voting system'.
Find out more at
https://edengreenspace.co.uk/business
Our Sponsor
KRYSTAL
are an award-winning, 100% renewably powered web hosting, with datacentres in the UK, US, & Europe. They are climate positive, and their approach centres on value, quality and transparency.
We are delighted to announce our partnership with Krystal (the UK's only B Corp web hosting/cloud provider), and welcome them on board as sponsors of the People, Planet, Pint events.
This means
the first 10 drinks
are on Krystal at every event, and has allowed us to invest and upscale the series to accelerate action on climate change.
Simon Blackler
is the founder of
KRYSTAL
, and Co-Founder of
MillionTreePledge
.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
location:
The Flask, 14 Flask Walk,
London NW3 1HE,
UK

title: Nottingham - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
Location: Library at Broadway cinema
The Broadway cinema is an iconic presence at the heart of Nottingham’s cultural quarter - in Hockley. To find it
follow this link
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about sustainability, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Hosts
Fred Paterson
has been supporting small businesses on their sustainability journeys for more than a decade, in his role as Associate Professor for Sustainable Business at Derby University, in setting up the Low Carbon Business Network and as Founder of
Accelerate the Shift
. At these informal events, Fred will help small business leaders navigate the increasingly crowded market of 'net zero’ support and resources. He is also a big fan of pastries, so working with Small99 to launch People, Planet, Pastry in Nottingham is a match made in heaven. We look forward to hearing about your sustainability journey at a People, Planet Pastry session near you, very soon.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
are our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Broadway Café Bar, 14-18 Broad St,
Nottingham NG1 3AL,
UK

is Managing Director of Brighton-based digital marketing agency

He led the company’s B Corp certification and is committed to doing everything possible to help restore our climate using business as a force for positive change. A graduate of the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership, Sam runs
Low Carbon Leaders
, co-founded
The Million Tree Pledge
and works closely with Clean Growth UK and our local authorities on business transition to net zero. Connect with him on
LinkedIn.
Ed Chinn
I'm focused on creating a positive impact through my work, for the wider community and (as much as possible) the planet. Essentially, leaving the world in a better place than I found it. I look to do this connecting people, ideas and insights via groups like People, Planet, Pint! as well as LinkedIn and Twitter. I’m a keen advocate of positive action through innovation, conscious capitalism and building a more circular economy. Via a range of sources, including fellowship of the RSA and podcasts (I highly recommend John Richardson and the Futurenauts!) to name a couple, I am passionate about educating myself about how I can be a better citizen and ancestor.
Grace Prior
With a career spanning hospitality, marketing and recruitment across global organisations before joining Silicon Brighton, Grace is passionate about making Brighton the destination for people in technology. If you're a technologist looking to become a community advocate, or a business looking to get behind our mission through event or wider strategic partnership opportunities, then get in touch.
Silicon Brighton
Silicon Brighton is a community-led initiative supporting digital growth in the South East. We really believe in Brighton, its people, and its potential. Working hand-in-hand with the local tech community, we support a number of Meetups across the city, providing individuals with free opportunities for networking, training, up-skilling and development, helping them to take their careers and businesses forward.

Caeryn Collins - My view is that the real (magic) happened when I put my own values on the business. We are also launching the RGB Rebels Club which is a Bi-monthly meeting in partnership with Wigan and Leigh College.
I regularly support other local businesses, Social Enterprises, charities and the councils in the areas we work in. title: Communicate Conference: Manchester
description:
Communicate, the UK’s leading annual conference for environmental communicators return to Manchester on 25 November 2025

Our theme for 2025 is Against The Odds. Together we face unprecedented challenges for the environment, our communication and engagement sector, our audiences and our organisations. Yet together, against the odds, environmental communicators continue to collaborate on innovative ways to connect people and nature – reaching across audiences, breaking down barriers, and amplifying a wide range of voices and actions for nature. 

Communicate conference has been running since 2004, bringing together professionals from across the UK to define, debate, and share best practice. It’s a place to gain inspiration, work together on new initiatives, build your networks and forge connections.
location:
Museum Of Science and Industry, Manchester M3 4JN,
UK

title: Become a People Planet Pint Host!
description:
What does Hosting a People Planet Pint mean? Explore the ways you can get involved and host a much loved event series in this webinar
In this informative session, you will learn about the mission and vision of People Planet Pint, our achievements so far, and how you can benefit from becoming a host. We will discuss the various hosting opportunities available, the impact your support can have on our community initiatives, and the mutual benefits of this partnership.
Key Topics Covered:
Introduction to People Planet Pint: Our story, mission, and values.
The impact of our community initiatives on a local and global level
Sponsorship opportunities: Different levels of sponsorship and the benefits associated with each.
Q&A session: Get all your questions answered by our team and make an informed decision about joining us as a host.
Why Host People Planet Pint?
People Planet Pint
(PPP)
is more than just a series of informal meetups—it's a growing, vibrant
national network of sustainability-minded professionals, entrepreneurs, and changemakers
.
With over 100 active locations across the UK and beyond, PPP brings together individuals who care deeply about creating a better future for people and the planet.
1.
Authentic Brand Alignment with Sustainability
Our attendees aren't just passive listeners—they are
action-oriented individuals
working in sustainability, community organisations, clean tech, ethical business, and climate policy.
Your support places you
at the heart of real climate conversations
happening in local pubs, co-working spaces, and community hubs across the country.
2.
Engage With a High-Quality, Values-Driven Audience
Our community includes:
Sustainability professionals
Small business owners
Innovators and startup founders
Local government and NGO representatives
Sponsors get access to this
valuable, engaged, and passionate network
—a unique blend of grassroots and professional spheres.
3.
Hyperlocal and Scalable Reach
With events happening regularly in dozens of cities and towns, you have local impact and are part of an international movement of change.
4.
Positive Brand Visibility—Without the Greenwash
Unlike traditional event sponsorships, PPP is intentionally
non-corporate and community-led
, creating a trusted environment where you are a supportive partner through grass roots organisations. This builds long-term trust and awareness
location:
1 Mill Street | Coworking Space, 1 Mill St,
Royal Leamington Spa,
Leamington Spa CV31 1ES,
UK

title: Bournemouth - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Karley Woodford
is the Site Director at Patch Bournemouth, based on the first floor of Bobby’s. Patch is a co-working club with a passion for people, nourishing local communities, reinvigorating high street spaces and embracing a culture of care.
When Karley’s not at Patch, you’ll find her hosting Yoga retreats as part of her side hustle as a Yoga Teacher or exploring the great outdoors with her Spanish rescue pup.
Nick Whitnell
is founder of Daring Works, a Dorset based consultancy and coaching business passionate about nurturing purposeful outcomes to achieve sustainable success.
With an extensive career in corporate marketing, Nick made the decision to leave that world and follow his heart by training with B Corp as a ‘B Leader’ and also as a soulful coach.
Nick is never far from the sea and loves exploring Dorset on his bike.
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.
We’re also breaking the mold of traditional sustainability training by empowering teams with the confidence and ownership over positive actions they can take with in person experiences.
Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Patch Bournemouth, Square,
2-12 Commercial Rd,
Bournemouth BH2 5LY,
UK

title: Belfast - People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Hello! I am
Bryony
a business owner and a mum to three and a sausage dog owner. (Ben)I am passionate about change. I wish to leave a legacy for my children, “Our Planet,” and raise climate awareness through conversations.
https://www.thinkpragmatic.uk
About Us
Small99
is a platform that guides small business owners to Net Zero and avoids the overwhelm. Small99 organises the PPP events, with the belief that bringing people together will spark unexpected solutions to collaboration in tackling climate change.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“
We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
2 Royal Avenue, 2 Royal Ave,
Belfast BT1 1DA,
UK

title: Barcelona - Small99's People, Planet, Pint™: Sustainability Meetup
description:
Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
Venue: Bar La Querida
[English below]
¿Te interesa la sostenibilidad? ¿Quieres conocer y hablar con otra gente interesada en ella? Acércate al próximo People, Planet, Pint y podrás crear nuevas conexiones con gente a la que también le preocupa cuidar del planeta.
No hay agenda, no es un taller ni una charla. Simplemente nos juntamos para tomar algo una vez al mes y conectamos con otras personas a las que les interesa la sostenibilidad, intercambiamos ideas, creamos nuevas conexiones o comentamos temas de actualidad. ¡Dejamos que la conversación y la tarde nos lleven adonde quieran!
Todos impactamos el medio ambiente de una manera u otra, así que ven y aprende cómo puedes tomar acción para un futuro más sostenible en tu comunidad.
Al fin y al cabo, para crear un futuro sostenible necesitamos comunidades unidas y conectadas entre ellas, y ¿qué mejor manera de conectar que tomando algo? Las primeras 10 personas tienen bebida gratis, cortesía de nuestro sponsor :)
//

Your Volunteer Hosts
Silvia de la Cruz
Silvia is a sustainability strategist and seasoned ecommerce professional with a passion for making a positive impact. She's focused on helping companies effectively communicate and market their sustainability initiatives to drive meaningful change. She loves the ocean, sharks and whales particularly, and does scuba and freediving when she can.
Ash Woodhall
made Catalonia his home in 2018, moving from Sheffield, England after a year of travel in Latin America. He is defined by his warm heart, friendly approach to life, and occasional sense of dark British humour.
Ash enjoys co-hosting the Barcelona People Planet Pint event so he can learn and meet people with similar interests. For work, he runs a micro-company,
Practical Infosec
, supporting positive-impact organisations by helping them stay safe online.
For fun, you can find him pretending to be a coffee barista at home, writing his personal blog, watching Liverpool FC (usually not) win the league, trying to run his first half-marathon, or getting his ass kicked at chess.
Jo-Anne Godden
Jo is a circularity expert committed to positive change to the textile industry. She has purposefully led
RubyMoon
, a sustainable fashion company whilst investigating textile recycling & helping women entrepreneurs. Originally from Brighton, Jo has launched RubyLab in Barcelona: dedicated to circular textile innovation. Jo loves sea swimming and also organises year-round "Full Moon Swims."

Your Volunteer Host
Linda Aspey
is an executive coach, facilitator, supervisor, therapist, and global faculty at Time to Think. She supports businesses large and small, and leaders and teams with their climate, environmental and societal challenges, bringing the latest social psychology and “Active Hope” for better communications, engagement and action. She runs various free climate cafes and workshops, and speaks and writes on climate psychology, leadership, mental health and social justice. Linda loves seeing how the growing number of businesses in and around Chipping Norton are doing amazing things to tackle the many challenges of our time, and how talking more openly about “climate change” is helping more and more people to make a real difference.

Polly Chappell
works as a sustainability consultant in Bath, supporting a range of organisations to create and deliver aspirational sustainability and net zero strategies. After graduating with her Masters in Management and Sustainability at the University of Bath, she did not want to leave this beautiful city. She is passionate for sustainable living, nature, sports and wellbeing, and spends her spare time trail running, road cycling or open water swimming.
Steve Coates is a chartered engineer and programme manager. His personal interest is in how climate change and global security are intrinsically linked and whether you are working on a major government project, in the supply chain as a Small/Medium Enterprise or taking actions at home, we can all contribute to making the world a safer and more sustainable place to live. Steve lives in Newbridge, Bath, and spends his spare time dog walking, running and brewing his own craft beer.

title: HackSummit
description:
Join 500 industry leaders exploring Abundance in energy, supply chains, climate adaptation, and defense.
Abundance is redefining the future of climate and industry.
For this year’s HackSummit, we’ll shift the conversation from reductionary approaches, and instead explore plentiness, and the new ways of manufacturing and adapting to a world that continues to grow.
Expect honest (and potentially heated) discussions on topics including, on-shore manufacturing, increased energy demand, post industrial food systems, supply chain resilience, automation, climate adaptation, weather modification and Climate Tech’s role in defense and sovereignty.
Come join 500 Stealth to Series B Founders, strategic investors, corporates, banks, and asset managers looking for their next collaboration in a world of abundance this December 10-11th at Newlab.
location:
Newlab, Brooklyn, USA, 19 Morris Ave,
Brooklyn,
NY 11205,
USA

Your Volunteer Hosts
Claire Zwozny-Bestwick
: I'm often introduced as my business name ‘CRZyBest’ and that's great, because I am Claire R. Zwozny-Bestwick. I’m a non-traditional, eco-friendly Silversmith & Sculptor, working from my CRZyBest Shedquarters in Derby, creating tiny sculptures in metal clay and turning them into jewellery and accessories. Ensuring our world is a happy place is really important to me, so when making CRZyBest creations I always try my best to look after my customers and our planet too, which is why I make every effort to source my energy, tools and materials from sustainable and ethical sources. Before starting my business, I was a teacher for 20 years and I still very much enjoy supporting others in their businesses, creativity and sustainability journey. I’m a massive advocate of collaboration over competition and my favourite things to make are inspired by dogs and beer, so when I’m not creating in my Shedquarters, you can find me walking my dog or sharing stories with people in my favourite pub, so what better next step than to start hosting ‘People, Planet, Pint’ in The Flowerpot!

title: Bromley - Small99's People, Planet, Pastry
description:
Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local  climate action.
People, Planet, Pastry
If you’re interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends!
This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action.
The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our “Pastry” series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability.
While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if you’re curious about what’s going on, come on down!
Your Volunteer Host
Angela Hulm
About Small99, Founders of PPP
At
Small99,
our vision is to build resilient & prosperous communities & companies.
We host the UK's fastest-growing sustainability meet-ups, People Planet Pint and People Planet Pastry, which now take place in over 140+ cities across 15 countries, with around 80 events a month.

Since 2023, we have directly trained over 3,000 businesses on Net Zero and carbon reduction and have reached over 50,000 businesses with our events and digital tools.
Our Sponsor
Small99 is delighted to partner with
Sage
who will become our key People Planet Pastry sponsor.
The support of Sage will allow us to cover our event cost (including pastries), but also to expand to more cities and keep the conversations and decarbonisation actions growing.
Sage is helping SMBs decarbonise through tech solutions and education.
Conrad Langridge, Sage Earth:
“We have seen the success of the People Planet Pint series run by Adam and the team, and having attended a number of sessions we know the value this is bringing the small business community, we wanted to support People Planet Pastry series to build on that success but in a way that focuses on SMB decarbonisation as a direct action."
location:
Greener and Cleaner, High St,
Bromley BR1,
UK

Ruth
is a founding member of OXygen, a purpose-led design agency focusing on accessibility and sustainability in digital design and communications for global clients. She also works as part of the wider Oxford HR Group, leading on impact measurement and communications. Ruth holds a degree from the London School of Economics and currently studies part time for an MSc in Sustainable Development at the University of Sussex. She lives just outside of Oxford with her dog and has a keen interest in climate action.
As the founder of two successful digital marketing businesses and an ex-PwC consultant,
Ned Wells
has helped organisations of every hew to thrive through precise, strategic, digital marketing.
Today, he only works with organisations that prioritise people and planet alongside profit. B Corps, Greentech businesses, social enterprises and charities that trade. His passion and expertise is crafting marketing strategies to drive social and environmental change.
Outside of work he’s an emergency foster carer, a business coach for prison-leavers, and a campaigner for cleaner rivers. He serves as a trustee for a primary education charity in Oxfordshire and for a grant-making foundation in London. Oh and he’s learning to do a handstand and sing in Welsh (not at the same time).

title: Become a People Planet Pint Host!
description:
What does Hosting a People Planet Pint mean? Explore the ways you can get involved and host a much loved event series in this webinar
In this informative session, you will learn about the mission and vision of People Planet Pint, our achievements so far, and how you can benefit from becoming a host. We will discuss the various hosting opportunities available, the impact your support can have on our community initiatives, and the mutual benefits of this partnership.
Key Topics Covered:
Introduction to People Planet Pint: Our story, mission, and values.
The impact of our community initiatives on a local and global level
Sponsorship opportunities: Different levels of sponsorship and the benefits associated with each.
Q&A session: Get all your questions answered by our team and make an informed decision about joining us as a host.
Why Host People Planet Pint?
People Planet Pint
(PPP)
is more than just a series of informal meetups—it's a growing, vibrant
national network of sustainability-minded professionals, entrepreneurs, and changemakers
.
With over 100 active locations across the UK and beyond, PPP brings together individuals who care deeply about creating a better future for people and the planet.
1.
Authentic Brand Alignment with Sustainability
Our attendees aren't just passive listeners—they are
action-oriented individuals
working in sustainability, community organisations, clean tech, ethical business, and climate policy.
Your support places you
at the heart of real climate conversations
happening in local pubs, co-working spaces, and community hubs across the country.
2.
Engage With a High-Quality, Values-Driven Audience
Our community includes:
Sustainability professionals
Small business owners
Innovators and startup founders
Local government and NGO representatives
Sponsors get access to this
valuable, engaged, and passionate network
—a unique blend of grassroots and professional spheres.
3.
Hyperlocal and Scalable Reach
With events happening regularly in dozens of cities and towns, you have local impact and are part of an international movement of change.
4.
Positive Brand Visibility—Without the Greenwash
Unlike traditional event sponsorships, PPP is intentionally
non-corporate and community-led
, creating a trusted environment where you are a supportive partner through grass roots organisations. This builds long-term trust and awareness

title: 9th International Conference on Environmental Sustainability and Climate Change
description:
"Coalesce Research Group is delighted to welcome all the Speakers, Delegates, Researchers, Students and Industrialists to be a part of our ""9th International Conference on Environmental Sustainability and Climate Change”. It is a two-day conference going to be held from April 27-28, 2026, in Berlin, Germany.

The theme of the conference is “Current Research on Environmental Sustainability and Climate Change” covering a wide extent of critically vital sessions of Environmental Science and Climate Change equally. Environmental Science section will cover all the major and minor topics which help in finding solutions for environmental problems (Air Pollution, Water Pollution, Soil Pollution, Noise Pollution, Thermal Pollution, Radioactive Pollution and Light Pollution) and Global Warming. We will also cover the technology section which plays an important role to maintain sustainable development for Future Technology, Renewable Energy like Solar Energy, Wind Energy, Wave Energy, Geothermal Power and more.

The conference includes Keynote and Plenary Sessions, Speaker Sessions, Young Researcher Forum, Workshops, Symposia, Video Presentations, Poster presentations, E-Posters, Exhibitions and also an opportunity for B2B meetings on the most recent improvements in the field of Environmental Science, Ecology, Climatology, Renewable Energy, Trade and Policies, Risk, Pollution Control, Mitigation Natural Resources and many more... by specialists from both Scholastic and Commerce foundation.

Scope and Importance

The goal of environmental sustainability is to conserve natural resources and to develop alternate sources of power while reducing pollution and harm to the environment. Controlling the environmental pollution, conservation of the environment and biodiversity are the major focus areas of all the countries around the world. In this context, the importance and impact of biotechnological approaches and the implications of biotechnology must be thoroughly evaluated. Environmental biotechnologists are playing a key role by applying biological processes to technology to create more sustainable societies.

Aim of the Conference

This conference deals with the scientific concepts that underpin modern biotechnologies and how innovations can be exploited for the development of products and processes such as biofuels, novel bioactive compounds and waste conversion technologies. You’ll also explore the bioethical, socio-economic and regulatory aspects of environmental sustainability and the role of biotechnologies in environmental protection.

Target Audience

• Biologists

• Geologists and Geo Scientists

• Ecologists • Climatologists

• Meteorologists

• Marine Biologists

• Oceanographers

• Chemical and Biological Engineers

• Environmental Engineers

• Researchers and Innovators

• Academic Faculty and Students

• Training Institutes

• Associations, Societies and Professional Bodies

• Industries

• Environmental and Climate Change Policy Analysts

• Non – Governmental Organizations

• Business Entrepreneurs

•Environmental Policy Makers

• Public Health and Environmental Epidemiologists

•Environmental Law Professionals

• Climate Finance Experts

•Waste Management Specialists

• Biodiversity Researchers

• Renewable Energy Experts"

title: 21st ECMWF workshop on high performance computing in meteorology
description:
Part of ECMWF's 50th anniversary celebrations in Bologna taking place at:
DAMA - Tecnopolo di Bologna, Via Stalingrado 84/3, 40128 Bologna
Exploring the past, present and future of HPC in meteorology
Overview and theme
As we celebrate 50 years of ECMWF, we invite you to the 21st edition of our biennial workshop on the use of high-performance computing (HPC) in meteorology, taking place from 15 to 19 September in Bologna, Italy.
This year's theme, Exploring the Past, Present and Future of HPC in Meteorology, highlights the transformative impact that high-performance computing has had over the years in advancing weather forecasting, climate modelling, and extreme event prediction and the crucial role it continues to play in the present and in the future.
With the rapid evolution of exascale computing, data-driven modelling, and sustainability challenges, this workshop provides a timely opportunity to reflect on the past, assess current developments, and explore future directions in computational meteorology. 
We welcome researchers, industry experts, and policymakers to join us in examining cutting-edge advances, engaging in insightful discussions, and sharing breakthroughs with leading scientistis and technologists shaping the future of the field.
Workshop description and aims
Every two years, ECMWF hosts a workshop on the use of high-performance computing (HPC) in meteorology. The workshop provides an opportunity to bring together experts from across the national weather centres, academia and industry to discuss and present recent developments and impact of high-performance computing for weather forecasting applications.
It is opportune, given the Centre’s 50 years of operation, to reflect on the role of supercomputing facilities in advancing insights into numerical weather prediction and how these services will need to evolve to meet the new challenges facing the meteorology communities.
Our aim is to provide a forum where users from our Member States and experts around the world can report on recent experiences, achievements and plans in the diverse field of high-performance computing.
Registration and call for abstracts
Registration and abstract submission have now now closed.
 

https://events.ecmwf.int/event/460/
location: ECMWF, DAMA - Tecnopolo di Bologna, Via Stalingrado 84/3, 40128 Bologna, Italy

title: CATRINE project and TransCom online workshop
description:
Speakers: Anna Agusti-Panareda (ECMWF)

Workshop Timings: 15:00 to 18:00 (BST), 16:00 to 19:00 (CEST)

 
The CATRINE project will host an online workshop to discuss a new TransCom model intercomparison protocol focusing on high resolution and the transport of CO2 from fossil fuel emissions.
Registration is open to the CATRINE project participants, the TransCom community plus invited guests. Registration will be moderated by the event organisers.
Background and motivation:
Monitoring the greenhouse gases CO2 and CH4 from space has made great strides over the past decade, in particular in terms of imaging capability. Existing instruments for CO2 include NASA's Orbiting Carbon Observatory-2 (OCO-2) with continuous sampling of cloud-free regions along the orbital path at a resolution of 3 km2, and NASA's OCO-3 which introduced the possibility of performing successive side-by-side scans of small areas (∼80 × 80 km2). For CH4, the TROPOMI instrument on board Copernicus Sentinel-5P provides near-daily surface coverage of cloud-free regions at a spatial resolution of up to 38.5 km2. In addition, retrieval capabilities at higher spatial resolution are emerging, for instance from Copernicus Sentinel-2 or from Greenhouse Gases Satellite (GHGSat). In the near future, the Copernicus CO2 Monitoring Mission (CO2M) will extend the imaging capability of CO2 to a level comparable to the existing one for CH4 from TROPOMI. This new wealth of CO2 and CH4 satellite retrievals pushes the application of such satellite data towards the inference of anthropogenic emissions and absorptions, with target spatial scales much finer than the traditional zonal or subcontinental scales of global atmospheric inversions. In this regard, the current generation of global atmospheric transport models that operate primarily at resolutions coarser than one degree, risks obsolescence because most models cannot exploit the higher resolution information in which most of the anthropogenic signals reside.
With this new protocol, we aim at stimulating high-resolution tracer transport modelling by setting-up a dedicated intercomparison exercise. By “high-resolution”, we first mean the equivalent of a grid spacing of 100 km in the horizontal, or a minimum of 51,000 horizontal grid points (about 1 degree × 1 degree resolution in the Tropics) to pave the world. On the vertical, we put a simple lower limit of 50 layers between the surface and the top of the atmosphere, assuming that it implies sufficient refinement of the planetary boundary layer and around the tropopause for constructive intercomparison. Indeed, the model vertical profiles will be particularly looked at in this exercise. We expect that their evaluation for several tracers using observed profiles from tall towers, aircraft and AirCore soundings will shed some light into the current discrepancies of atmospheric inversions that assimilate column retrievals or air-sample measurements. 
Simulated tracers will be compared with each other, as will vertically integrated mass fluxes for total column. The reference observations will be diverse: ground-based or satellite tracer retrievals, air-sample measurements, as well as meteorological observations. We will define metrics to score the model performance. We will investigate how model configuration, like the vertical resolution, influences the model skill. The diagnostics will be applied to all tracers on weekly to monthly timescales, focusing on the impact of transport errors on the seasonal cycle at various layers and the total column. The correlation between the errors in the different layers with the error in the total column will support the attribution of the transport error.  The high-resolution simulation database will be the first of this sort and may serve various applications beyond the planned model evaluation, from, e.g., model uncertainty quantification to AI training. 
This initiative originates from the European project Carbon Atmospheric Tracer Research to Improve Numerics and Evaluation (CATRINE), which funds the coordination of the intercomparison, as well as some contributors, but it is hoped that other partners in the world will join the momentum and contribute to the study with their respective model and expertise. 
The meeting will include half a day of presentations and discussions of this new protocol to get input from the TransCom community.
The CATRINE project is funded by the European Union, Grant Agreement 101135000.
