title: Czech Space Week 2025
description:
Czech Space Week 2025 will span from October 20 to October 26 across multiple venues in the Czech Republic. This event stands as the largest and most comprehensive space festival in the country, uniting companies, startups, academics, and government stakeholders under a singular mission. Since its establishment in 2018, Czech Space Week has evolved into a critical platform designed to accelerate innovation, collaboration, and investment within the Czech and broader European space sectors.

**Core Events and Strategic Focus**
===================================

The festival features a curated lineup of events catering to industry professionals and the general public. The flagship **Space2Business** conference showcases collaborative opportunities, technological breakthroughs, and market trends shaping space-related enterprises, both domestically and internationally. Complementing this, the **Copernicus User Forum** convenes experts focusing on Earth observation technologies and their applications, emphasizing the region’s commitment to leveraging space data for environmental and security purposes.

Moreover, Czech Space Week highlights pressing themes such as space defense and international cooperation. A notable seminar titled “Defending European Interests in Space” addresses strategic challenges linked to space security, particularly in light of recent geopolitical tensions. The festival also fosters global dialogue by including sessions aimed at strengthening partnerships with Indo-Pacific space actors.

Empowering Diversity and Public Engagement

Czech Space Week actively promotes gender diversity through the **Space4Women** initiative. This platform spotlights female leadership and encourages greater inclusion across all space industry levels, from research to entrepreneurship. Public outreach remains vital, with educational workshops, exhibitions, and family-friendly programs designed to inspire youth and engage wider society.

The week culminates with the elegant **Space Gala**, celebrating achievements and fostering networking among key players in government, industry, and academia. This multifaceted approach ensures that Czech Space Week functions as more than a conference: it serves as a vibrant nexus where innovation meets policy, and science intersects with commerce.

### Czech Republic’s Ascending Role in Space

The Czech Republic distinguishes itself as one of the most successful newcomers within the European Space Agency, actively contributing to around 500 ESA projects. Its strengths lie in satellite technology, launch vehicle development, and Earth observation missions. Czech companies and subcontractors are highly engaged in these domains, demonstrating a competitive edge alongside Western European nations.

By hosting such a diverse and well-structured festival, Czech Space Week fortifies the country’s position as a dynamic and influential player in the global space economy. The 2025 edition not only spotlights national achievements but also accelerates strategic partnerships and innovation transfer, aligning with Europe’s broader space ambitions.
organizer: Ministry of Transport of the Czech Republic

title: 7th SWF Summit for Space Sustainability
description:
🌐 Overview of the 7th Summit for Space Sustainability

Join us in Paris, France on 22–23 October 2025 for the 7th Summit for Space Sustainability, co-hosted by the Secure World Foundation (SWF), the Centre National d’Études Spatiales (CNES), and the French Government. This high‑level, multi‑day international forum focuses on developing concrete solutions to sustain safe, secure, and peaceful uses of outer space

Watch our exclusive Space Agenda TV interview, where Remco Timmermans talks to Krystal Azelton of SWF about why everyone should attend the event:

Why Attend?

▶️ Theme: “Acting with Intention: Stability, Sustainability, and Benefit” – This year’s summit centres on this guiding theme, shining a spotlight on regional and global initiatives in space sustainability

### 🎯 Key Topics Include:

Latest international policy developments and governance frameworks

* Atmospheric impacts of space activities
* Security, safety, and stability in orbit
* Growth of commercial space sustainability services
* Role of space applications in addressing Earth’s climate and development challenges

Who Should Attend?

Space is no longer the domain of a few. Whether you’re in government, industry, academia, civil society, or a student passionate about space policy and sustainability, this summit is for everyone. The event is structured to facilitate inclusive engagement—from policymakers and CEOs to researchers and young professionals. Live Q&A, spotlight talks, and interactive panels ensure all voices are heard

### Young Professionals & Scholarships

SWF places strong emphasis on the next generation. Young professionals benefit from discounted registration, mentorship sessions, and dedicated networking events. Scholarships, including for students, ensure broad participation

Venue & Format

📍 Centre de Conférences Pierre Mendès France, Paris  
📅 22–23 October 2025 (with a welcome evening on 21 Oct evening)

Hybrid format: attend in‑person or virtually, with interactive features via the Whova app—streaming and real‑time engagement in CET timezone

Benefits & Networking

* Connect with global leaders from government, private sector, and NGOs
* Gain insights on emerging challenges through keynote addresses and dynamic panels
* Explore new markets, including space-based environmental services
* Build partnerships and stay ahead of regulatory and technological shifts
* Strengthen skills—mentorship, policy-shaping, and professional growth

How to Register & Learn More

Visit [swfsummit.org](https://swfsummit.org) for full agenda, speaker bios, tickets (including student/YP discounts), and sponsorship details

* Press and media can register for free.
* Sponsorship packages are available for organisations seeking prime visibility and strategic networking

Don’t Miss the Video

For a deeper dive into what the summit offers—and why you should be part of the conversation—watch the insightful interview with Krystal Azelton on Space Agenda TV: Remco Timmermans explores the event’s goals, participants, and impact. Your first glimpse at the summit’s potential is just a click away!

In Summary

The 7th Summit for Space Sustainability Paris 2025 is a critical gathering for anyone engaged in space policy, sustainability, or innovation. With a powerful theme—\*“Acting with Intention: Stability, Sustainability, and Benefit”—\*this summit drives action on pressing global challenges. Secure your place in Paris or online—together, we can shape a sustainable space future for all.

description:
**Silicon Valley Space Week (SVSW) 2025** brings together two premier satellite industry events that provide deep insights into next-generation satellite technologies and the evolving space defense landscape. title: 71st International Congress of Aviation and Space Medicine ICASM 2025
description:
71st International Congress of 
Aviation and Space Medicine

ICASM 2025 in Singapore aims to unite the international community of aviation and space medicine professionals, scientists, researchers, and practitioners in collectively bringing aviation and space medicine to greater heights through professional exchanges and closer collaborations. The conference theme “Soaring Towards New Horizons in Aviation and Space Medicine” epitomizes the compelling and forward-looking scientific programme that will highlight the latest advancements and emerging trends in aviation and space medicine and other related fields.

I am excited and honored to share that the 71st International Congress of Aviation and Space Medicine (ICASM) will take place in Singapore from October 27-30, 2025.

ICASM 2025 aims to unite the international community of aviation and space medicine practicioners, scientists, academicians and researchers in the sunny island of Singapore for an unforgettable experience of learning, networking and collaboration. ICASM 2025 will include a rich scientific programme spanning over 3 days as well as unique visits and tours on the last day.

The theme for ICASM 2025 is “Soaring Towards New Horizons in Aviation and Space Medicine”. My team and I will be curating a compelling and forward-looking scientific programme that will highlight the latest advancements and emerging trends in aviaiton and space medicine, as well as other related fields. We look forward to your valued contribution as presenters, sponosrs and participants.

The congress will be held at One Farrer Hotel, situated in one of Singapore’s cultural districts. The location of this hotel holds historical significance as the first flight in Singapore took off here. On 16 March 1911, a Bristol Boxkite biplane took flight from the old Race Course at Farrer Park, the site which sits adjacent to this hotel.

One Farrer Hotel boasts a plethora of water and tropical gardens within its compounds, and also has a fully operational farm which provides greens in the food it serves. This provides a distinctive and inspiring backdrop for the conference, and showcases Singapore as a Garden City for all to enjoy.

Singapore is home to a global metropolis, a City in Nature, and a rich tapestry of rich and diverse cultures. During your stay in Singapore and as part of ICASM 2025, you will be introduced to a wide variety of food and cuisines, a stunning city skyline, and plenty of sunshine.

I would like to extend a warm welcome to friends from all around the world to join me in Singapore for ICASM 2025. With an exciting lineup of events and activities, I am certain you will have an unforgettable experience. See you in Singapore!

Dr. Benjamin Tan (Singapore

Chairman,

Organizing Committee  
ICASM 2025

title: 9th IEEE RADIO International Conference
description:
Welcome to IEEE RADIO 2025!

The 9th edition of IEEE RADIO will be held from 27th to 30th October 2025 in Flic-en-Flac, Mauritius. The aim of the conference is to discuss recent developments, theories and practical applications covering the whole scope of radio frequency engineering, including radio waves, antennas, propagation and electromagnetic compatibility.

Prospective authors are invited to submit original contributions on their latest research activities. Student papers are strongly encouraged. IEEE RADIO 2025 will feature three Best Student Paper Awards, a Young Scientist Award and an Industrial Engineering Paper Award. Proposals for special sessions, workshops and tutorials are welcome. A panel of distinguished researchers will deliver keynote speeches/invited talks on recent technology trends and advances.

IEEE Radio 2025 topics

Topics for this conference include:

* Antenna theory
* Wave propagation and scattering
* Electromagnetic compatibility
* Analytical and numerical methods
* Smart antennas and arrays
* RF components and systems
* Wireless communication systems
* Biological effects
* Radio astronomy
* Wireless power transfer
* Devices and circuits
* Nanotechnology
* Remote sensing
* High-power devices and techniques
* Instrumentation and measurement techniques
* Medical and industrial applications of electromagnetic fields
* Modeling, simulation, computer aided design
* Electronic packaging and integration
* Metamaterials and other novel materials
organizer: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers IEEE

title: International School on Space Optics ISSO 2025
description:
**ISSO 2025 will take place from 27 – 31 October 2025 at ESA-ESTEC in Noordwijk, the Netherlands.**

What is it?

The International School on Space Optics is an event that targets to serve the community of young engineers and scientists who are already active or have the aspiration to work in the field of Spaceborne Optics. It offers an intensive 5-days immersion program of lectures, design project and visits to space-related facilities. The course can be seen as a “compressed” 1-year class on Space Optics which would have been part of a Master Program in Spaceborne Technologies and Applications. It will allow 360 degrees exposure to all disciplines or optical engineering in space. A Certificate of Attendance will be provided to any participant that has been present consistently throughout the Course.

The first ISSO was organised as a “Winter College on Space Optics” in February 2015 at the UNESCO International Centre for Theoretical Physics – ICTP within the frame of the “2015-International Year of Light”.  Following this event it was decided to establish the ISSO as a systematic biannual event. In 2017 the ISSO was hosted at ESTEC. In 2019 the ISSO was hosted at ENEA in Rome, Italy. And ISSO 2021 was hosted online.

In 2025 the School will be held only physically in ESTEC with no option for on-line attendance.

Code of Conduct

The school organization is committed to providing an environment that is conducive to the free and robust exchange of scientific ideas. This environment requires that all participants be treated with equal consideration and respect. The participants are therefore expected to conduct themselves professionally and respectfully. All forms of bullying, discrimination, and harassment are prohibited. This policy applies to every individual at the event, whether attendee, speaker or other.

How many people will participate?

80 people will participate in ISSO 2025. The selection is based on merit and expected benefit for the student.

Why we do it?

Engineers and Scientists working on any discipline of spaceborne optics tend frequently to be very specialised in the narrow field of their first work missing opportunities in serving other disciplines. Also, optical engineers who have not yet engaged in any kind of activity in Space do not have a complete understanding of where their skills could be applied. The school will provide a 360- degree overview of the broad area of Space Optics covering Applications, Instrumentation and Technologies opening hence the horizons and opportunities for the young engineers/scientists to assess better all available opportunities.

ISSO is a sister event of the International Conference on Space Optics – ICSO and it is organised biannually in alternative years than ICSO.

The ICSO proceedings are freely and readily available on the ICSO proceedings site of the SPIE Digital Library.

CEAS Space Journal

The CEAS Space Journal includes a distinct field on “Optical, Optoelectronics and Photonics” and welcomes papers of ICSO in an extended version of the conference paper including theoretical analysis. Consider an electronic submission through the Journal [website](https://www.springer.com/journal/12567).

How much will it cost?

Thanks to the support of sponsors the fees for the students will be kept to a minimum registration fee.

Who should attend?

Young engineers or scientists with a background in any field of Optics, Optoelectronics or Photonics. Background should be demonstrated by:

* a Masters or PhD degree in any Optics discipline
* actively pursuing a PhD in any Optics discipline
* working as a researcher in any Optics discipline in a university or research centre or industry

Without having a strict age limit it is expected that the participants will be in generally younger than 40 years old and with limited experience in the field of Space Optics.

Certificate of Attendance

At the conclusion of the School a “Certificate of Attendance” signed by the School Directors, will be awarded to all students attending the full programme of lectures and visits.

Academic accreditation

Academic institutions can recognize the School for its merit. Notice that the University of Padova’s PhD course on Sciences Technologies and Measurements for Space (STMS) [PhD Course – Dottorato | CISAS “G.Colombo” (unipd.it)](https://protect-eu.mimecast.com/s/QHywCAngcyYm3vt8JPFy) accredits the ISSO with 2 Credit units ([https://www.study.eu/article/what-is-the-ects-european-credit-transfer-and-accumulation-system](https://protect-eu.mimecast.com/s/fBMqCBgjCQoZ9gUNU6Ib)).

Young Space Optics Professionals

Why don’t you ask our “alumnae” for a first hand account of what to expect from attending ISSO. [LinkedIn Link of YSOP.](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/9093885/)

title: ISAP 2025 International Symposium on Antennas and Propagation
description:
Welcome to ISAP 2025

Welcome to the 2025 International Symposium on Antennas and Propagation (ISAP2025) in Fukuoka, Japan, from October 27 to 31, 2025

The ISAP is a series of annual international symposium for the exchange on research and development in antennas, propagation, electromagnetic-wave theory, and other related fields. The first ISAP was held in Sendai in 1971, and this is the 30th time. The ISAP series have become absolutely one of major international conferences in the fields of Antennas and Propagation in the world.

This symposium is sponsored and organized by the Communications Society of the Institute of Electronics, Information and Communications Engineers (IEICE), and will be held in cooperation with the Antenna Measurement Techniques Association (AMTA), the Antennas and Propagation Society of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE/AP-S), the Antennas Society of the Chinese Institute of Electronics (AS-CIE), the Electrical Engineering/Electronics, Computer, Communications, Information Technology Association of Thailand (ECTI), the European Association on Antennas and Propagation (EurAAP), the Institute of Antenna Engineers of Taiwan, the International Union of Radio Science (URSI), the Korean Institute of Electromagnetic Engineering and Science (KIEES), and the Taiwan Microwave Association.

Conference Topics

This symposium will treat a wide range of subjects on antennas, propagation and electromagnetic-wave theory as suggested below. Papers concerned with other aspects of these subjects will also be considered. In addition, special topics treating emerging technologies heralding a new era in wireless communications and applications are invited for consideration.

### A. Antennas

A1 Small Antennas and RF Sensors  
A2 Antennas for Mobile and V2X Applications  
A3 Broadband and Multi-band Antennas  
A4 Smart and Reconfigurable Antennas  
A5 Reflector and Reflectarray Antennas  
A6 Planar/Printed Antennas and Arrays  
A7 Antenna Theory and Design  
A8 Antenna Measurements  
A9 Millimeter-wave, Terahertz and Optical Antennas  
A10 Metamaterials and Metasurfaces for Antennas

### B. Propagation

B1 Indoor and Mobile Propagation  
B2 Millimeter-wave, Terahertz and Optical Propagation  
B3 Propagation for V2X and IoT  
B4 Channel Sounding and Channel Estimation  
B5 Propagation for HAPS and UAV  
B6 Remote Sensing  
B7 Terrestrial, Earth-Space and Ionospheric Propagation  
B8 Underwater Communication  
B9 Propagation Measurement Techniques

### C. Electromagnetic-wave Theory

C1 Computational Electromagnetics  
C2 Time-Domain Techniques  
C3 Scattering, Diffraction and RCS  
C4 Inverse and Imaging Techniques  
C5 Optimization Methods in EM Problems  
C6 Passive and Active Components  
C7 Frequency Selective Surfaces and Filters  
C8 EBG, Metamaterials and Periodic Structures

### D. AP-related Topics

D1 RIS and Antenna Systems for Wireless Communications  
D2 MIMO and Array Signal Processing  
D3 AP-related Topics for B5G and 6G  
D4 Wireless Power Transfer Technologies  
D5 Wearable Device Networks and Medical Applications  
D6 ML and AI for AP Applications  
D7 RFID and Its Applications  
D8 EMC/EMI Technologies  
D9 DOA/TOF Estimation, Localization, Sensing and Radar

title: European Space Weather Week ESWW 2025
description:
The 21st edition of the major international conference, European Space Weather Week ESWW 2025 will take place in Umeå in the autumn of 2025. The event is expected to attract at least 500 participants from diverse sectors around the world, including academia, industry and governmental agencies.

The ESWW will mainly be organised by Umeå University with the help of Umeå Congress and a national scientific team.

“Umeå University is honoured to have been selected to host this prestigious event. The ESWW is an important platform for sharing knowledge, discussing the latest research, and exploring new frontiers in space weather and space climate forecasting and technology,” says Audrey Schillings, chair of the organising committee.

The ESWW aims to foster interdisciplinary collaboration and investigation of new technologies and approaches, such as machine learning, in a space weather and space climate context. The event is highly interdisciplinary and brings scientists together with space industries and actors interested in space weather and space climate.

A diverse range of events will mark the conference, including a summer school for students and early-career scientists, an exhibition fair, and engaging activities designed for children and the public.

The conference is scheduled for October 27 to 31, 2025, marking the first occasion this annual gathering will be hosted in Sweden.

About space weather

Space weather refers to the constantly changing conditions in space depending on the solar activity. Solar winds and solar flares are some of the main drivers for space weather events.

Space weather affects technological systems, both on Earth and in space, such as satellites, air traffic and electrical systems.

title: Software Defined Space Conference SDSC 2025
description:
Software Defined Space Conference 2025

The fifth instalment of the “Software Defined Space Conference” (SDSC) series, dedicated to the critical realm of cybersecurity in space, is set to unfold 28-30 October 2025 in Tallinn, Estonia.

﻿﻿

Through the use of software, we have the capability to transform how we utilise and gain benefits from our space assets. We can accurately predict and visualise future demands, while also facilitating the coming together of service providers and consumers.

It’s important to recognise that the increased value of space technologies today is primarily driven by software advancements and the expanding realm of connectivity. In 2022, the space sector entered a new era in which cyber security assumed a pivotal role in ensuring the uninterrupted provision of services and overall sustainability.

Hence, the primary focus of this event centres around two key areas: software development and cyber security within the realm of space technology. The overarching goal is to heighten awareness about the potential of these technologies, explore avenues for commercialisation, and foster the growth of the space community.

Call for exhibitors

The next conference will offer the possibility for organisations to present their technologies and ideas at the designated exhibition area. This is a perfect opportunity to network and connect with organisations, investors or other visitors.

Conference Website

All information will be made available in due course, at https://sdcs.ee/

title: COSPAR 2025 Symposium
description:
The Committee on Space Research (COSPAR) is proud to announce the COSPAR 2025 Scientific Symposium in cooperation with the Cyprus Space Exploration Organisation (CSEO).

This Symposium, themed “Space Exploration 2025: A Symposium on Humanity’s Challenges and Celestial Solutions”, will delve into critical global challenges such as climate change, resource depletion, and space weather, while exploring how space exploration and technology can offer solutions. It will present various matters related to ongoing and planned space programs, fostering discussions on international collaboration, ethical considerations, and the role of emerging nations in space exploration.

The event will bring together a diverse audience from around the world, including representatives from space and non-space companies, space agencies, international organizations, researchers, and the wider public.

Statement by the COSPAR President

“COSPAR’s mission is unique, bridging together both spacefaring and non-spacefaring nations offering them the opportunity to play a role in its realization. There is no other organization on the international scene having such a mission.

Our global role of fostering international space cooperation and peace – is aiming to establish a common level playing field.”

Pascale Ehrenfreund  
President, COSPAR

title: CADC Connecticut Aerospace & Defense Conference
description:
Welcome to The Connecticut Aerospace & Defense Conference CADC 2025!

The Connecticut Aerospace & Defense Conference (CADC) is a B2B event with focus on supply chain, manufacturing capabilities, services, and technologies with applications in aerospace and defense. CADC is exclusively based on BCI Aerospace’s signature matchmaking format and reserved for vetted professionals. CADC is an opportunity for suppliers, service providers, engineering, supply chain, procurement, product development teams to connect through pre-arranged meetings.

CADC is a supplier summit reserved for vetted aerospace & defense companies and based on pre-arranged meetings, held in Hartford, CT, USA, from 4 to 6 November 2025.

### RTX Conference Day

CADC 2025 first day will provide a full day of presentations by high level speakers from RTX. The sessions will feature executives and leaders covering commercial and military programs at Collins, Pratt & Whitney, and Raytheon. Each leader will address various key topics: trends, challenges and opportunities in market segments, expectations from suppliers, manufacturing automation, information integration.

Space typically is limited. We recommend you purchase your ticket as early as possible to avoid disappointment.

### Workshops

**Thematic Workshops**

These presentations focus on either technologies or products. This is a chance for a limited number of suppliers to reach an audience of professionals willing to increase and optimize their market knowledge. These activities will be held in parallel to the meetings and are subject to prior a approval.

**OEM Procurement and Supply Chain Policies Workshops**

These presentations are a great opportunity for professionals to better grasp supply chain and technical strategies of the Primes. Speakers typically provide insight into the process of engaging with the OEMs. These activities will be held in parallel to the meetings.

About BCI Aerospace

BCI Aerospace is advanced business events – abe, specialized division for aviation and defense oriented events. It was established in 1996 and has become world leader of business to business events for the aeronautics, space and defense industries.

title: Security for Space Systems (3S)
description:
***2025 Security for Space Systems (3S)*** Conference aims at bringing together academia and industry to present cutting-edge research and innovations in space systems security.

After the success of its inaugural edition, the 2025 conference will expand to include two review cycles and extend to two and a half days, ensuring ample time for in-depth discussions and engagement, to exchange knowledge on the latest security challenges and solutions for space.

In addition to the conference, there will be an industrial exhibition where European companies specializing in space systems security are invited to demonstrate their products through equipment displays or informative posters. This exhibition will offer a unique opportunity to connect with industry professionals, researchers, and stakeholders from the broader security community.

The Security for Space Systems 2025 will be held **in November 2025 at the European Space Research and Technology Centre (ESTEC)** in Noordwijk, the Netherlands.

Conference Topics

Innovative and research-driven submissions are solicited in, but not limited to, the following topics:

* Applied crypto for space.
* Avionics (spacecraft) security (security of avionics busses, on board data handling, processors, etc.).
* Ground segment security.
* RF jamming and anti-jamming techniques.
* Security at System level.
* Security for “New Space” and mega-constellations.
* Security of optical space communications.
* Security of space communication protocols (e.g. CCSDS).
* Security of satcom systems (e.g. 5G NTN, DVB-S2, etc.).
* Security of space relays and interplanetary missions.
* Security Policies for space.
* Security assurance, accreditation, and certification
* Software security for Space Systems

Conference Location

The conference will be located in ESA ESTEC (European Space Research and Technology Centre), in Noordwijk, The Netherlands. ESTEC is the largest site and the technical heart of the European Space Agency.

A digital leaflet with the map and safety&security information is available here: <https://esamultimedia.esa.int/docs/ESTEC/ESTEC_Safety_and_Security_Leaflet.pdf>. The presentations rooms and the restaurant are located in the A building (yellow).

European Space Research & Technology Centre  
Keplerlaan 1  
Postbus 299  
2200 AG Noordwijk (The Netherlands)

title: The Space Economy Summit 2025
description:
The Space Economy Summit 2025 gathers global leaders, entrepreneurs, and investors to discuss the booming multibillion-dollar space economy sector. This annual summit focuses on new market opportunities, emerging technologies, investments, and regulatory frameworks driving the next wave of space industrialization. Attendees benefit from expert panels, strategic networking, and visionary keynotes.

Exploring Expanding Market Opportunities

Participants will explore diverse opportunities across satellite communications, space tourism, space mining, data analytics, and Earth observation, which collectively fuel rapid sector growth. Moreover, the summit features detailed updates on government programs, commercial launch services, and innovative startups shaping the competitive landscape. Business leaders gain critical insights into evolving customer demands and future market trends worldwide.

Highlighting Innovative Technologies and Investments

The event showcases cutting-edge advancements in propulsion systems, reusable launch vehicles, satellite constellations, and in-orbit manufacturing. Additionally, investment forums connect venture capitalists, private equity, and public markets with promising space enterprises poised for scaling. This dynamic environment accelerates commercial space ventures while addressing regulatory and financial hurdles.

Shaping Policy and Partnership Ecosystems

The Space Economy Summit actively promotes dialogue on regulatory reforms, international cooperation, and sustainable space utilization guidelines. It brings together policymakers, industry experts, and academia to develop harmonized frameworks enabling safe and responsible space activities. Furthermore, the summit encourages public-private partnerships crucial for pioneering ambitious space projects globally.

For professionals engaged in space-related industries, the Space Economy Summit presents unmatched opportunities to gain insights, build alliances, and shape the sector’s future. Attending this summit is essential for navigating the complex dynamics that will define space’s role in global economic growth and innovation for decades to come.
organizer: Economist Impact (a division of The Economist Group)

title: Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering MBSE 2025
description:
Welcome to the Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering Workshop MBSE 2025

Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering (MB4SE) workshop is heading to Lithuania in 2025! 🚀

With the support of the MB4SE Advisory Group, and [Sensmetry](https://www.linkedin.com/company/sensmetry/), this prestigious event will further strengthen the Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) community across the European space domain. And what better place to host it than Vilnius – the vibrant capital of one of ESA’s Associated Member States!

📅 Save the Date: 5-7, November 2025  
📍 Where: Vilnius, Lithuania

The call for workshops is already open! Submit your proposals by 15 March 2025.

We look forward to welcoming the MBSE community to Vilnius and showcasing Lithuania’s commitment to innovation and the space sector! 💡🌌

Call for Workshop and Training Session Proposals during MBSE2025 Vilnius

Space Hub LT at Innovation Agency Lithuania, the European Space Agency, in cooperation with the Model Based for System Engineering Advisory Group, and Sensmetry are excited to announce an open call for workshops and training sessions proposals to be featured at MBSE 2025 (5-7 Nov 2025, Vilnius). This multi-day event will bring together experts, practitioners, and enthusiasts for immersive training and collaborative work focused on Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) with a specific focus on the space domain.

We invite proposals that emphasize practical learning, hands-on interaction, group work and engaging discussions.

**​Event objectives: Accelerating the adoption and use of MBSE in the space domain**

#### Lowering adoption barriers

* How can we improve usability (visualization, analysis, reporting), emphasizing decision support aspects
* What is the migration path (existing projects, existing data, existing processes, MBSE applied in specific context)

#### Empowering the workforce

* What skills are required (re-training, coaching, champions,…), bridging the gap between domain knowledge and MBSE expertise
* Changing roles (interaction engineer – system engineer – project manager) and re-prioritize our use-cases as a function of experiences

#### Integration of tools and processes

* Where do we need interoperability, and why
* Enabling domain-specific activities in digital engineering workflows

How do we bridge the gap between top down (semantic definitions / ontologies) and bottom up (data exchange formats, tool focus)? How to bridge the gap between left and right-side of the V-model?

### Session Types and Format​

Timeslots are available either as 1 hour or 2.5-hour slots for individual sessions. Larger sessions can be proposed by combining multiple 2.5h slots (at most three).

### We are seeking proposals for:

* Training Sessions: sessions focusing on MBSE tools, languages, and methodologies. Training sessions are intended to provide participants with skills and insights they can directly apply to their MBSE projects, focused on space mission development.​
* Workshops: sessions (individually or in combined blocks) that encourage participant involvement and discussion. We encourage a broad interpretation of “workshop” and welcome the following formats:

1. Collaborative Group Work: Structured group exercises focusing on MBSE topics, addressing practical problems or other common challenges.​
2. Tool Application Sessions: Practical, hands-on workshops where participants work on MBSE projects or problems using specific tools or methodologies.​
3. Hackathons: Time-boxed challenges on MBSE problems or tasks, which may include a pre-workshop preparation phase and/or follow-up work (e.g. a pitch presentation at the end of the last day).​
4. Roundtable Discussions: Facilitated discussions where participants can share perspectives, solutions, and insights on MBSE-related issues.​
5. Other: We welcome unique approaches to MBSE education and collaboration. Feel free to propose innovative formats that you believe will engage participants effectively.​

title: Startup Startcamp Bremen SPACE
description:
**FROM IDEA TO STARTUP IN 54 HOURS**

**About STARTUP STARTCAMP BREMEN SPACE**

STARTUP STARTCAMP BREMEN SPACE is designed for those who are interested to (co-)start a SPACE, SPACE-ENABLED, or SPACE-RELATED startup:

* Transform a space or space-enabled or space-related startup idea in just 54 hours!
* Pitch your idea in 60 seconds (no slides) or join an idea that you are passionate about.
* Find awesome like-minded people, grow your network & learn new skills.
* Test your assumptions, conduct market research, tune your business model, develop your demo or prototype.
* On Sunday, pitch your startup concept to a jury & public audience, get feedback – and maybe your own startup will be born this weekend!

Please find the examples of how this event format has paved the path for two startups in these LinkedIn posts: [Valispace post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-bremen-startup-activity-7120808176072941569-rg3y "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-bremen-startup-activity-7120808176072941569-rg3y") & [WasteAnt post](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_bremenstartups-bremen-startup-activity-7121106185902010369-QME5 "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_bremenstartups-bremen-startup-activity-7121106185902010369-QME5").

For all event details, please check the following**FAQ, event schedule, video & lineup**:

**1)****WHY Startup Startcamp Bremen SPACE?**

Bremen is a European SPACE hotspot with 140 companies, € 4 Billion annual revenue, 20 top research institutions , 12.000 people employed and host of Europe’s largest B2B space event – the [Space Tech Expo Euro](https://www.spacetechexpo-europe.com/ "https://www.spacetechexpo-europe.com/")– which starts just two days after the Startup Startcamp (2024, Nov. 19-21).

Bremen also has a vibrant startup & tech community as well.  
Since 2015, the [#BremenStartups](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=bremenstartups "https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=bremenstartups") community has a proven track record on facilitating startups & entrepreneurial journeys.

And it works! There have been founded above a dozen of Startups from previous events like Startup Startcamp Bremen SPACE! These events were the initial starting point for attendees to go for their entrepreneurial journey and launch startups like Valispace, satsearch, SPiN, or Jelly Space!

**2)**BUT I’M NOT A SPACE ENGINEER OR SCIENTIST!**Is that event for me?**

SURE!  
Because STARTUP STARTCAMP works by a variety of skills and experiences.

Wether you are…  
…idea giver or ar a potential co-founder…  
…professional or student…  
… designer / creative, software or hardware developer, business or industry expert…  
… you will be valuable for your team at STARTUP STARTCAMP!

**3)****Will I get support?**

You are not alone! Experienced founders, experts & coaches will support you (check the out below). Also food & drinks are included in your ticket so that you can focus and concentrate on your project.

**4)****Should everyone pitch startup ideas?**

It is entirely your choice to pitch a startup idea or join the team of an idea you believe in. Either ways, we want you to enjoy this exhilarating experience of building startups. Your idea should be something you have not previously worked on. **Please find the TOP 10 input about the idea pitches in**[**this LinkedIn Post.**](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-pitchfire-bremen-activity-7120076651849244672-j8nc "https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jan-wessels_startupidea-pitchfire-bremen-activity-7120076651849244672-j8nc")

**5)****What is the language of the event?**

The event moderation and all pitches will be in English. You can discuss with your teammates and mentors in the language of your choice.

**6)****Do I register only myself or do I have to register as a startup team?**

Register yourself. You can’t register as a team. Don’t worry if you don’t know anyone attending. We will help everyone form groups, and there will be lots of possibilities to mingle and get to know other attendees.

**7)****How big are the teams?**

Teams of 4 to 5 members are the ideal number for optimal results.

**8)****What do I need to bring?**

A laptop and a desire to contribute! You must be able to attend Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

**9)****I’m not from Bremen. Can you recommend accommodation close to the event location?**

The eventlocation ([DIGITAL INDUSTRY HUB BREMEN](https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/ "https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/"), Konrad-Zuse-Straße 6a, 28359 Bremen) is embedded in the technology park of the University Bremen.

Thus, the DHI is very easy to be reached by public transport. The station “Lise-Meitner-Straße” is just five minutes walk distance from the DHI and is served quite frequently by various tram & bus lines. E.g. the tram line #6 needs just twelve minutes from the main train station to the DHI.

Thus, you can find several hotels in the area around the DHI, but if you are looking for other accomendation options in Bremen, the public transportation makes it possible to easliy get from there to the DHI.

Please check also the “Getting there” infos for bike, scooter, car & public transport on the page of the DHI here: [https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/contact-us-getting-here/](https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/contact-us-getting-here/ "https://digitalhubindustry.de/en/contact-us-getting-here/")

**10) What is included in the ticket price?**

Your ticket includes food, drinks, and one-on-one time with amazing mentors over the course of the weekend.

Please check thankfully the awesome supporters of [bremen-startups.de](https://www.bremen-startups.de/ "https://www.bremen-startups.de/") who semi-sponsor the tickets so that we can provide you more value than what you actually pay for.

**ATTENDEE TICKETS are limited to 50 tickets in total!**

First come, first serve. Don’t wait to the last day to book your ticket 😉

* **ATTENDEE TICKETs**  
  – SUPER EARLY BIRD tickets for €25 -> are limited to the first 10 bookings.  
  – EARLY BIRD tickets for €40 -> will be available for bookings #11-30  
  – REGULAR tickets for €55 – > will be available for bookings #31-40  
  – LATE BIRD tickets for €70 – > will be available for bookings #41-50
* **VISITOR TICKET**(5 Euro):Just wanna watch the final pitches on Sunday, Nov 17, 16:30h – 20:00h? Get a **VISITOR** ticket (limited to 50 tickets).

Check the **SCHEDULE & LINEUP BELOW** to get an impression about STARTUP STARTCAMP BREMEN!

Any questions, please email [Jan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jan-wessels/ "https://www.linkedin.com/in/jan-wessels/") at: jan.wessels@bremen-startups.de

title: 7th Shaw-IAU Workshop on Astronomy for Education
description:
The **7th Shaw-IAU Workshop on Astronomy for Education** is a fully virtual event that will take place from **November 18-21, 2025**. Hosted by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) Office of Astronomy for Education (OAE), this global event is designed to advance astronomy education at primary, secondary, and university levels.

### **Who Should Attend?**

This workshop is ideal for educators, researchers, and educational policymakers involved in astronomy education. Whether you teach primary school students, guide university-level educators, or develop curriculum materials, the event offers a unique opportunity to exchange ideas and collaborate with experts worldwide.

### **Key Highlights**

1. **Focus on Astronomy Education:**
   * Explore innovative teaching methods and tools for astronomy education in schools.
   * Learn from successful practices in teacher training and classroom implementation.
2. **Specialized Science and Education Sessions:**
   * **Science Focus:** Galaxies – Gain insights into teaching astronomy concepts using cutting-edge scientific discoveries.
   * **Education Focus:** Teaching with authentic data – Learn how to integrate real astronomical data into classroom activities.
3. **Multilingual Accessibility:**
   * Presentations and posters are welcome in any language, with English subtitles or translations for accessibility.
   * Regional and special language sessions will be available to foster global collaboration.

### **Why Attend?**

Supported by the Shaw Prize Foundation, Klaus Tschira Foundation, and Carl Zeiss Foundation, this workshop continues its tradition of excellence in advancing global astronomy education. Attendees will gain tools and strategies to inspire the next generation of astronomers, making complex topics accessible and engaging for students.

Join this transformative event to connect with a global network of educators and researchers.

title: LATSAT 2025
description:
Welcome to LATSAT 2025: Gathering Latin America’s Space Industry Leaders!

LATSAT, organized by Novaspace, is the premier forum that unites senior-ranking public and private decision-makers from the satcom, connectivity, and Earth observation sectors in Latin America. This unique event provides an unparalleled platform to network, explore sector advancements, and foster business opportunities.

Programme

The two-day program will be rhythmed by high-level keynotes speeches and thematic round tables featuring 40+ high-level government officials and industry executive speakers from Latin America and the rest of the world.

The program reflects perspectives and insights on the most critical issues facing the industry today. Amongst the topics addressed are Universal Access, national security, space programs & public/private collaboration, Earth observation, national broadband connectivity, the digital ecosystem, smallsat opportunities, manufacturer solutions, VSAT services, and digital ground solutions.

LATSAT 2025 Value Proposition

### Join the entire space ecosystem

Join 200+ public and private senior-ranking decision makers from the satcom, connectivity, and Earth observation sectors. LATSAT will gather the industry key players including satellite manufacturers, launchers, ground service providers, satellite and telecommunication operators and broadband service providers, national space agencies and governmental entities for two days of high-level debates, exchanges, and business meetings.

### Learn from and be inspired by the top minds​

Hear 40+ high-level business leaders sharing industry perspectives, best practices, and how challenges become opportunities. LATSAT’s program will initiate discussions on the regional and global markets most relevant issues, as well as on prospects and challenges for the Latin American market in a global setting. The debates will reflect market dynamics and address lessons learnt, stimulate innovation and allow attendees to stay up to date with market trends, leaving the event fully equipped for future business adventures.

### Take your business to the next level

Connect with 200+ senior-ranking decision makers during the exclusive social events organized as part of the event. LATSAT offers a world class opportunity for public and private Latin American space stakeholders to meet, network, share lessons learnt, and plan the development of their business in Latin America with regional and global counterparts.

Novaspace: Connecting Industry Leaders

Since 1997, Novaspace has been at the forefront of organizing the most prestigious and renowned events and thematic conferences within the space industry. These gatherings bring together the world’s leading decision-makers to benchmark progress, exchange views, gain valuable market insights, foster existing or potential partnerships, and seal important deals.

title: Aerospace & Defense Meetings Torino
description:
What are the Aerospace & Defense Meetings Torino?

Over the past editions, A&DM Torino has established itself as the only international matchmaking event for the aerospace and defense industry in Italy. Across three days, participating companies have the chance to meet, build targeted business relations and develop new projects with partners from all over the world. We are constantly evolving to meet industry demands and are unlike other typical aerospace events. A&DM Torino connects OEMs and their Tier 1 & 2 suppliers with manufacturers and service providers from both civil and defense aviation, through a series of individually tailored one-to-one meetings.

### Key topics

* Sustainability & Green Aviation
* Space Ecosystem & Lunar Economy
* Defense & CyberSecurity
* Advanced & Urban Air Mobility
* Industry 5.0:AI/data

### Event Format

* One-to-one meetings: A&DM Torino brings together the entire supply chain and all its key players through a smart matchmaking program.
* Conference sessions exploring the key challenges and opportunities of the future of aerospace.

The business matchmaking platform is the perfect tool to meet the contacts of your choice!

Why Aerospace & Defense Meetings in Torino, Piemonte Region?

**TORINO-PIEMONTE IS A LEADING GLOBAL HUB FOR AEROSPACE**

As the seventh largest in the world and fourth in Europe, with a turnover of over 14 billion € and a workforce of 47,274 highly specialized employees, the aerospace industry represents the largest manufacturing sector in Italy in the field of high-tech integrated systems.

Explore the Piemonte Aerospace Supply Chain and find your next business partners at A&DM Torino!

title: Space-Comm Expo Scotland
description:
Space-Comm Expo Scotland at SEC Glasgow is the new catalyst for one of the world’s leading space nations at the forefront of the UK’s global ambitions.  
The Scottish space industry is thriving and one of the fastest growing in Europe. Glasgow designs and builds more small satellites than anywhere outside of California. Scotland is home to five spaceports aiming to be a strategic launchpad for the northern hemisphere with multiple launch vehicle operators. Scotland is famous for world class downstream data capabilities, technology for deep space missions and is home to over 150+ space companies with the sector underpinned by government, business, clusters and universities.

Space-Comm Expo Scotland is supported by the Scottish Government, UK Space Agency, UKspace, Scottish Enterprise, South of Scotland Enterprise, Highlands and Islands Enterprise and Space Scotland with plans to attract international delegations and visitors from across Europe and the global space community, alongside Primes, SMEs and Start-Ups.

Space-Comm Expo Scotland will follow the award-winning format of previous events with Scottish based companies to the fore alongside international exhibitors, product demonstrations, keynote speakers, multiple conference theatres, roundtables and 1-2-1 networking opportunities.

A future-focused platform

From satellite platform primes, satellite operators, military, government and application developers, this free to attend exhibition and leading seminar will encapsulate the growing space ecosystem, focusing on the small satellite revolution, the internationalisation of the value chain, the acceleration of spaceports and the increasing commercialisation of the sector.

Did you know?

150+ space companies currently operate from Scotland, including renowned global and emerging companies and operating costs can be up to 40% lower in Scotland than elsewhere in the UK. Space-Comm Expo Scotland will provide a valuable opportunity for the sector to display each area of the supply chain to buyers with active and growing budgets, and drive future workforce.

Where?

As the place that makes more satellites than anywhere else in the world outside of California, Space-Comm Expo Scotland will take place at SEC Glasgow, 3-4 December 2025

title: Space Travel Summit 2025
description:
Welcome to Space Travel Summit 2025

A new era in Space travel has begun. The powerful partnership between government and private sector is unlocking boundless opportunities for humankind to explore the space.

Join us at the Space Travel Summit, 8 – 9 December 2025 – a World class event in the MENA region connecting space ecosystem and shaping the future of the space economy. Get ready to meet, engage, network with top industry players, and discover the latest advancements from the global space exploration pioneers. Take a part of two days of high-impact conference featuring by global industry experts.

Space Travel Summit brings together the biggest names of the space industry, governments, regulators, investors, international space agencies, academics to share knowledge, understanding, collaborate and close the deals.

Come and feel the state of industry!

Where industry stakeholders and innovation converge

In a world filled with boundless opportunities, space travel stands as a testament to human innovation and the insatiable quest for knowledge. Witness the incredible growth of the space travel industry, fueled by unending fascination, and discover the vast resources that awaits us beyond earth’s atmosphere. Let’s boldly venture into the universe, shaping a sustainable future for generations to come.

STS Vision

Building an ecosystem in the space travel industry that sustain future innovation through an inclusive market by empowering existing stakeholders and introducing new key players who can make the future of space development brighter and stronger.

STS Mission

Using the new gaps resulting from commercial space industry growth as opportunities and valid entry points for nations with the highest potential yet struggle with the lack off accessibility due to the commonly known exclusivity of space sector.

STS Community

A diverse constellation of individuals, startups, industry affiliates, experts, government representatives, academia specialists, regulators, and more. Join forces with government sectors, private entities, academic institutions, space agencies, organizations, media outlets, students, and environmental advocates. Together, we chart the course for a unified exploration into the vast realms of space travel.

About the Organizers

Nirvana MICE emerged as a dynamic division of Nirvana Holdings, specializing in Meetings, Incentives, Conferences and Exhibitions. The company offers a sweeping array of event management services, meticulously tailored to embrace their client’s unique needs. They curate events that transcend the ordinary, embodying their commitment to innovation, sustainability and sophisticated experiences.

title: Airspace Asia Pacific 2025
description:
Airspace Asia Pacific 2025: Shaping the Future of Airspace Management

Join us for the inaugural **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025**, a groundbreaking exhibition and conference dedicated to advancing air traffic management (ATM) and unmanned traffic management (UTM) across the Asia Pacific region. Scheduled for **December 9-11, 2025**, at the **AsiaWorld-Expo in Hong Kong**, this event promises to be a pivotal gathering for industry leaders, policymakers, and innovators.

Uniting the Airspace Community

The **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025** event, organized by [CANSO](https://canso.org/), will bring together over **100 exhibitors** and representatives from more than **50 key Air Navigation Service Providers (ANSPs)** across **100 countries**. This unique platform will showcase cutting-edge technologies and innovations designed to address some of the most pressing challenges facing the airspace community today, including:

* Safely managing the increasing air traffic in one of the world’s fastest-growing regions.
* Achieving aviation’s ambitious net-zero carbon emissions goal by 2050.
* Seamlessly integrating new airspace users such as eVTOLs, drones, and space launch vehicles into crowded skies.

A Hub for Networking and Collaboration

Attendees will benefit from unparalleled networking opportunities, allowing them to connect with industry peers, share insights, and collaborate on solutions that enhance safety and efficiency in airspace management. The event will feature two dedicated theatres for discussions and presentations, alongside CANSO’s Asia Pacific leadership conference for ANSP CEOs.

Why This Event Matters for the Space Industry

The relevance of **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025** extends beyond traditional aviation; it is crucial for the burgeoning space industry as well. With increasing interest in space launches and satellite operations within urban environments, this event will address how to integrate these new technologies into existing air traffic systems. By fostering dialogue between airspace managers and space industry stakeholders, the conference aims to create a cohesive strategy for safe and efficient airspace utilization.

Be Part of the Future

Don’t miss your chance to be part of this landmark event that aims to shape a safer, more efficient future for airspace management in the Asia Pacific region. Join us at **Airspace Asia Pacific 2025** to explore innovations, network with industry leaders, and contribute to discussions that will define the future of our skies. Secure your spot today!
organizer: CANSO Civil Air Navigation Services Organisation

title: NSE ExpoForum 2025 – New Space Economy
description:
The 7th edition of NSE ExpoForum is Europe’s benchmark event for the New Space Economy, bringing together a dynamic ecosystem of industry leaders, startups, institutions, researchers, and students. Hosted at Fiera di Roma, this three-day event fosters strategic dialogue and innovation across the entire space value chain—from Earth observation and satellite constellations to lunar missions, sustainability, and AI applications.

🔹 What to Expect:

✅ High-Level Scientific Conference – Curated by a distinguished scientific committee, tackling frontier topics across materials, AI, satellite services, and planetary exploration  
✅ TechTables – Dedicated think tanks for project incubation and strategic collaboration  
✅ NSE Pitch Competition – Recognizing the most innovative startups in the space sector  
✅ NSE Arena – Live demos, product showcases, and dynamic talks from industry experts

🔹 Special Highlight:  
🌍 The Space Golden League – NSE joins forces with 3 other top European space conferences to create the first pan-European communication and collaboration platform for space

title: AIAA SciTech Forum 2026
description:
The **AIAA SciTech Forum 2026** will be held from **January 12 to 16, 2026**, at the **Hyatt Regency Orlando** in Florida. Recognized as the world’s largest aerospace research and technology event, it will attract over 6,100 professionals from 48 countries. This forum serves as a premier platform for sharing cutting-edge aerospace science, innovation, and technology.

The event features a comprehensive technical program alongside plenary and Forum 360 sessions. The technical program includes detailed presentations addressing aerospace challenges and solutions. Each session consists of six 20-minute presentations followed by Q&A. Plenary sessions focus on strategic issues shaping aerospace’s future, while Forum 360 offers interactive discussions with industry leaders and experts.

**ABOUT THE ORGANIZER**

**American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)**, a leading professional society dedicated to advancing aerospace science and technology[1](https://aiaa.org/scitech/)[2](https://aiaa.org/scitech/utility/about/information-organizers/)[5](http://www.showseye.com/fairs/AIAA-SciTech.html). The organizing team includes a guiding coalition of aerospace experts from major industry players such as Lockheed Martin Space, NASA, Honeywell, Northrop Grumman, and academic institutions like TU Delft and Carnegie Mellon University[2](https://aiaa.org/scitech/utility/about/information-organizers/). These experts oversee the technical program, ensuring a high-quality, comprehensive agenda covering aerospace research, innovation, and emerging technologies.

Keynote speeches will be delivered by renowned aerospace figures. Panel discussions will explore emerging trends, technologies, and policy impacts. Workshops will provide hands-on learning and foster collaboration among attendees. An international exhibition will showcase the latest aerospace innovations, products, and services. Networking events will enable meaningful connections among academia, industry, and government professionals.

The venue, Hyatt Regency Orlando, is located at 9801 International Drive and offers easy access to Orlando International Airport, about 13 miles away. On-site parking and public transportation options are available. The hotel provides modern conference facilities and comfortable accommodations for attendees.

Important deadlines include manuscript submission by December 2, 2025, with abstract submissions opening earlier. Presenters must register and participate in session preparation to ensure smooth knowledge exchange during the event.

The forum covers aerospace engineering, propulsion, materials, space systems, and emerging fields like artificial intelligence, autonomous systems, and sustainability. Collaborative research and innovation will be strongly encouraged.

AIAA SciTech Forum 2026 is essential for aerospace professionals seeking advanced knowledge and networking. It offers unparalleled opportunities to engage with global experts and accelerate aerospace technology development.
organizer: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)

title: 8ᵗʰ Winter Satellite Workshop
description: The Winter Satellite Workshop is the largest New Space meeting in Finland, Scandinavia, and the Baltic countries, bringing together space tech specialists, scientists, and students to discuss key developments in the rapidly evolving space sector.

title: Space Debris Conference 2026 (SDC2026)
description:
Following the success of SDC2024, the Space Debris Conference 2026 (SDC2026) will once again bring together global experts, researchers, policymakers, and space industry leaders to confront the growing challenge of space debris and promote sustainable space operations.

🔹 Key Objectives:  
✅ Drive forward international cooperation and joint frameworks to mitigate space debris  
✅ Highlight new technologies for debris tracking, avoidance, and removal  
✅ Advance global policies and licensing standards for safer space environments  
✅ Promote the role of private sector innovation in remediation solutions  
✅ Explore the future of space governance, SSA, and traffic management

🔹 Conference Highlights:

1. Keynotes from SSA, UNOOSA, ITU, NASA, LeoLabs, ClearSpace, Astroscale, Axiom, and more  
2. Sessions on debris mitigation, AI in SSA, regulatory frameworks, and in-orbit servicing  
3. Outcomes aimed at building a global consensus for sustainable orbital use

title: APACE 2026
description:
The **Asia Pacific Aerospace Conference & Exhibition (APACE) 2026** will take place in Sarawak, Malaysia, serving as a premier aerospace event for over 1,000 professionals from more than 50 countries. Hosted by the **Ministry of Education, Innovation and Talent Development (MEITD) Sarawak** and organized by **Borneo Business Connect Sdn Bhd**, APACE aims to establish Sarawak as Borneo’s aerospace hub and a leading player in Asia-Pacific’s aerospace industry. The event combines innovation, sustainability, and regional collaboration to accelerate aerospace growth across the region.

A Strategic Platform for Aerospace Innovation and Sustainability

APACE 2026 spotlights cutting-edge aerospace advancements, including green aviation, AI-driven aerospace solutions, and digital twins, which are transforming the industry worldwide. Moreover, it promotes sustainable technologies and practices, reflecting global commitments to reducing environmental impact. Participants will engage with over 100 exhibitor booths showcasing breakthroughs in satellite technology, sustainable aviation fuels, and advanced manufacturing processes. This diverse exhibition fosters cross-sector innovation, encouraging partnerships that address both commercial and environmental challenges within aerospace.

Extensive Program Featuring Expert Panels and Workshops

Spanning three impactful days, APACE 2026 offers more than 60 sessions, including high-level keynote speeches, technical workshops, and panel discussions led by global aerospace leaders, CEOs, policymakers, and researchers. These sessions focus on the latest trends, such as workforce development, digital transformation, and regulatory frameworks shaping the industry’s future. Importantly, the conference emphasizes talent development by connecting students with industry mentors and practical internship opportunities, ensuring the pipeline of aerospace expertise remains strong.

Networking Opportunities Driving Business and Policy Collaboration

The event creates dynamic environments for interaction among industry executives, investors, government officials, and academics. Dedicated networking zones, investor pitch sessions, and collaboration forums facilitate deal-making, knowledge exchange, and strategic alliances. Business Events Sarawak (BESarawak) supports the event, further reinforcing Sarawak’s ambition to grow its aerospace cluster through international cooperation. Consequently, APACE 2026 acts as a catalyst for boosting aerospace investments and regional economic development.

Why Aerospace Professionals Must Attend APACE 2026

For engineers, entrepreneurs, policymakers, and investors, APACE 2026 offers unparalleled market insights, exposure to emerging technologies, and access to vital business networks. The conference’s location in Sarawak provides unique opportunities to engage with a rapidly expanding aerospace sector within the dynamic Asia-Pacific market. Furthermore, attendees benefit from exploring innovative solutions aligned with global aerospace trends while influencing regional and international policies for sustainable aviation growth.

APACE 2026, Sarawak’s Aerospace Milestone

the Asia Pacific Aerospace Conference & Exhibition 2026 represents a landmark event uniting industry pioneers dedicated to advancing innovation and sustainability in aerospace. Through its comprehensive program and extensive networking opportunities, APACE empowers participants to shape the future aerospace landscape in Sarawak and beyond

title: Aerospace & Defense Summit Istanbul 2026
description:
The **Aerospace & Defense Summit Istanbul 2026** will convene on **January 28–29, 2026**, in Istanbul, Turkey, a pivotal hub between Europe and Asia. This premier event attracts industry leaders, government officials, entrepreneurs, and investors seeking to advance aerospace and defense technologies while forging valuable partnerships across continents. Attendees benefit from unique strategic insights on global market trends, technological evolution, and geopolitical influences that shape this dynamic sector.

Istanbul’s Strategic Location Enhances Global Industry Collaboration

Istanbul’s unique position at the nexus of eastern and western markets offers unparalleled access to diverse aerospace and defense ecosystems. Turkey’s rapid growth in aerospace manufacturing and defense systems makes the summit a crucial forum for cross-border business development. Moreover, Istanbul’s expanding innovation clusters create fertile ground for collaboration, enabling international companies to navigate complex supply chains and regulatory environments effectively. Consequently, the city ensures the summit delivers unmatched networking advantages for professionals worldwide.

The summit’s agenda focuses on maximizing high-impact B2B meetings, interactive workshops, and sector-specific roundtables designed to accelerate collaboration. Participants will explore advanced manufacturing techniques, system integration challenges, and supply chain resilience strategies. Additionally, sessions on emerging digital technologies including AI-enabled defense solutions, additive manufacturing, and cybersecurity help attendees stay ahead of rapid technological change. Therefore, the event provides actionable opportunities to build partnerships and expand market reach efficiently.

Why Industry Professionals Should Prioritize Attendance

Attending the Aerospace & Defense Summit gives executives and engineers timely access to shifting defense priorities, procurement strategies, and emerging markets worldwide. The event facilitates direct dialogue with government policymakers, leading prime contractors, and innovative startups driving aerospace transformation. Furthermore, small and medium enterprises gain essential visibility for commercial growth and integration into global value chains. Early-year scheduling also enables participants to align corporate investment and development plans with evolving international aerospace demands.

Istanbul Summit as a Catalyst for Industry Leadership

The Aerospace & Defense Summit Istanbul 2026 serves as an essential platform to accelerate innovation, forge strategic networks, and influence the global aerospace and defense landscape. Istanbul’s geographic and economic strengths amplify participants’ ability to thrive in international markets. Industry professionals focused on long-term success must leverage this event to build partnerships, discover emerging technologies, and shape future sector dynamics decisively.

title: International Space industry exhibition (ISIEX) 2026
description:
The **International Space Industry Exhibition (ISIEX) 2026** will take place from **January 28 to 30, 2026**, at the world-class **Tokyo Big Sight** in Koto-ku, Tokyo, Japan. Organized by **Nikkan Kogyo Shimbun Ltd.** This exhibition attracts global companies, academic institutions, government agencies, and startups eager to showcase cutting-edge space technologies and foster international cooperation. As a result, ISIEX 2026 becomes the key event for advancing space market development, technology exchange, and commercial partnerships globally.

A Premier Venue for Uniting Space Stakeholders

Tokyo Big Sight, located at **3-11-1 Ariake, Koto-ku, Tokyo 135-0063, Japan**, offers a state-of-the-art environment with excellent transportation links for easy access by global visitors. Moreover, Nikkan Kogyo Shimbun Ltd., a major industrial news company in Japan, leads the organization along with substantial support from space agencies and industrial partners. With approximately **300 exhibitors** and **20,000 visitors** expected, this venue will host a diverse range of space industry sectors, including communications, robotics, satellite development, and space environment conservation.

Comprehensive Exhibits Addressing Industry Innovations

The exhibition will cover critical areas like communication satellites, ground station development, robotics innovations, environmental monitoring, and spacefood production technology. Additionally, space debris management, remote sensing, space insurance, and space travel will feature prominently, underscoring the sector’s complexity and fast-paced growth. Exhibitors will include heavy industry manufacturers, venture-backed startups, and research organizations aiming to expand market access and commercialize new technologies. Consequently, the event provides unparalleled exposure to emerging trends and investment opportunities worldwide.

Facilitating Networking and High-Level Dialogues

ISIEX 2026 emphasizes interactive forums, technical panels, and dedicated networking sessions designed to connect thought leaders, engineers, investors, and policy makers. For example, thematic discussions on lunar exploration and spaceport development help spur collaborative initiatives and public-private partnerships. Therefore, attendees can form strategic alliances accelerating space projects’ success and drive regional and international cooperation. This environment fosters direct dialogue essential for tackling technical challenges and regulatory complexities facing the space industry.

Why Professionals Should Attend ISIEX 2026

Industry professionals, entrepreneurs, and officials gain firsthand knowledge about new technologies, policies, and market strategies at ISIEX. Moreover, by attending this event, they can tap into Asia’s growing space economy while accessing global investment and cooperation networks. Furthermore, the timing strategically aligns with accelerating space commercialization and international space diplomacy. Thus, ISIEX 2026 represents a must-attend event for stakeholders committed to shaping the future of space innovation and business on a global scale.

Accelerating Space Innovation at Tokyo Big Sight

Ultimately, the International Space Industry Exhibition 2026 sets a global stage in Tokyo, accelerating cross-sector collaboration, technology exchange, and sustainable growth in space industries. By participating, space professionals position themselves at the forefront of a transformative era in space exploration and commercial development.

title: Space Suppliers Summit
description:
International Summit & Meetings for the Space Manufacturing Industry

The Space Suppliers Summit is an international business convention connecting buyers and suppliers from across the space manufacturing sector. Now into its second edition, the convention is an opportunity for companies to showcase their unique capabilities, share insights and ideas, and create new networks through targeted business meetings and a high-level conference.

The two-day event will consist of a dedicated conference programme investigating new trends, developments and challenges across the space manufacturing and supply chain infrastructure from a business and industry technology perspective.

The second day features our signature one-to-one pre-scheduled business meetings between participants in the exhibition. The meetings will provide you with a tailored programme to meet selected companies in a well-organised format that lets you focus on your meetings, while we take care of the logistics.

Who will you meet?

The Space Suppliers Summit is for companies working in the design, development and manufacturing of space systems, including spacecraft, payload and launch systems, plus the professional ground segment required for their test, assembly, and operations.

Profile of attendees

We are connecting buyers and suppliers from across the manufacturing supply chain. Profiles of attendees include:

* Institutional Partners

### Buyers & End-Users

* Procurement

title: Aerospace Meetings Queretaro
description:
